x63okYaRw-6pTQuu27mC4w.text: This is authentic Chicago. More precisely, authentic Elmwood Park, the west suburban Italian enclave. Th Chicago-style hot dogs are dead-on & delicious. The beef sandwiches are almost as good as Johnnies - home of the best beef on Earth (in Elmwood Park, of course).   The sauteed peppers are superb; the only thing holding it back is the bread - definitely not Gonnella's, but really good anyway. If you want to know what a real Chicago Italian beef tastes like, go here. It's an experience everyone should enjoy at least once in their lifetime.

OJXpg7mJjNtPMZ2-vNiOpA.text: I'm sure there's some joke that begins with "This New York food-snob walks into a Chicago Hotdog place...." Well, NY & Chicago have two well-known food battles:  NY Pizza vs. Chicago Pizza & New York Hotdogs vs. Chicago Hotdogs.  You know what? Who cares which one is better, it's the most delicious food battles ever!  While I haven't found any good places for NY style hotdogs, this place makes GREAT Chicago style hotdogs.   I'm so happy this place is right down the street from me.  The second I walked in and the smell hit me, my stomach started smiling.  I was intimidated by the menu because there are so many things I want to try.  My good buddy from Chicago came with me and said it's the closest he's had to real Chicago style food he's found in Las Vegas. I ordered the Chicago Style hotdog and the Maxwell Polish Sausage(Spicy).  The lady behind the counter asked if I wanted fries, I declined, but she threw some in for me anyway.  Damn her!  I'm trying to watch my weight lol. Needless to say, everything was awesome!   The hotdog had snap, great flavor and the polish sausage was grilled with a nice amount of char on it and was just awesome.  Fries were great too.   I allow myself one day a week to eat unhealthy food and Windy City will probably be seeing me for the next two or three weeks.  I want to try the Pizza Bites, Tamales, Thin-crust Pizza and Stuffed Crust Pizza.  They have Cheli's Chili.  I'm a huge Hockey fan and that's Chris Chelios' Chili company...he was a defenseman for the Chicago Blackhawks for those not familiar.  I can't wait to try it all!

Kgi4s_AxI3FxgWwmJj5U-g.text: Stopped in for lunch today and tried the original Chicago dog and Italian beef with au jus on the side; delicious food and we'll definitely be back again. When we walked in, the owner was helping clean up the tables which shows that he takes pride in his business and we appreciate that. The woman who helped us had a great attitude too. Don't forget a chocolate dipped cheesecake for dessert!

lGYZTzMBqDPQpfNrprN-1Q.text: This place was great.  We loved the wings, deep dish, chili cheese fries and the thin crust.

XiyJf_Ixc4lVlbnCEVNS9A.text: Chichen wings are delicious and pizza is okay. People who work there are not all that friendly but maybe they are just in character, not sure. I wouldn't go back for the pizza but I would go back for the wings

hg3b736nqGI9dMMWQnTMlQ.text: This is our favorite Chicago food joint. Been going for a couple years now ....you walk in the door and you think your back home. The staff and owner are awesome and the food is authentic. I can't say anything negative about Windy City. We've had just about everything on the menu and have never had a bad experience. During football season Bears fans come together and have the best time. If you haven't been there you need to make it a point to go soon...you won't be disappointed.

zC9AjcaDNQyxeZ_LApRXCA.text: Came here for the Bears game since my dad is from Chicago. He enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

KDLaaH_e_JA4ogO_kCoHmQ.text: Ok - let's start with the important stuff...  1. The Italian Beef is dope. I suggest getting it dipped, the bread holds an amazing amount of flavor that way.  2. Meat Trio Deep Dish - as good a deep dish as i have ever had outside of the actually city of chicago. I really liked it the couple times we've ordered one, only slight complaint was that the bacon was just a touch underdone, but the pie was still awesome.  3. Pizza Puffs - these are not panzerottis exactly, but they are pretty damn good.  I have yet to get with the vienna beef hotdogs here but i am sure they live up to all the other menu items.  The staff is always in a good mood and very nice.  Calling ahead to pick up orders is a breeze and they keep your info in their system so if you just wanna repeat what you had last time they already know what that was.  Highly recommend this place.  Good eats.

GphjLBop7cTIm9PyEWPAQQ.text: My husband really likes this place. A lot. I like the face that they remember my name when I walk in. I love the Chicago hotdogs, not a fan of the round pizza cut into squares.  That's just weird. But the dogs and Italian beef are awesome. The service is excellent as well.

_E39w35gOB5NBi3-vXHUaw.text: For those who know "Chicago Food" and especially "Chicago Style Pizza", this is the place to go..

PzHf_0Pns1xDUbKojIblxQ.text: I reviewed this establishment 2 years ago, and I'm delighted to say they have improved the menu flavors from what I had considered  to be 4 star to now a 5 star!  They minimized or eliminated the spicy black pepper amount that was in the Italian beef back at that time and they took out the sweetness in their pizza sauce making it more like we have in Chicago.  Their hot dogs by far are the best in Las Vegas and this is supported by being VOTED #1 in the recently published LV REVIEW JOURNAL 2015 "BEST OF LAS VEGAS" SURVEY.  CONGRATULATIONS WC... you earned it!   Also, one of my favorites is the Italian beef and sausage combo.... It's delicious!   Finally,  try the cheeseburger and gyros....I know you will be impressed.

eCamuFqUy_OhWDUF-WuGXg.text: Sweet Chicago pizza We had thick and thin, either way you can't go wrong. 8 slices for the deep dish. It had mildly sweet sauce and canned tomatoes, good portion of cheese and the crust isn't too thick!

cpshxcjlBTyQoSh6IbL3eA.text: If this is what Chicago deep dish pizza is about, then New York Pizza will always be number ONE.  The pizza was so bland.  Theres more flavor with a microwave pizza.  The three of us each ate a slice, and left the rest of the pizza on the table and left.  We went next door to nothing bundt cakes and we were so much happier with that.

GGyYbnAhVNAm-KqlvclbpQ.text: One of my friends from Chicago raves about this place, and even asked me to vote for their other location on the Las Vegas Review Journal;s best hot dogs award.  That was couple of years ago, and I never voted for them because I never made to that location, but I have to agree with him now on their sister location.  When I think of Chicago foods, the first thing I that comes to mind is the SNL skit of the Mike Ditka fan's.   Just watching those guys " Kobayashiing" a bunch of dogs, and self-resuscitating themselves back to life after getting a massive heart attack was pretty funny.   Well, this could happen if you ate this way 24/7, 365 days a year, but what the heck....you have to treat yourself once in awhile, and why not here because it's sinfully good.  Located across the parking lot from Krispy Kream on Eastern, Windy City looks small at the door front, but once you walk in, the dining area expands to a pretty good size room.   The staff is super friendly, and I armed with my groupon deal from them...damn, it was a heck of a deal.  I'm no expert on deep dish pizza, but this pie is worth the drive.   Personally, I'm more of thin crust pizza guy, but this pie is my exception.   The crust at it thinnest area is about twice as thick as thin crust pizza, and it does need it because this pizza is packed with Meat, and cheese.   The sweet chunks of tomatoes flows with the sauce on top, and this pie is not weak hearted, because after eating two slices I was done for dinner.   It was tasty, filling, and reminded me of the old Red Lion pizza in Waikiki(back in 1990's)  From what seen on the daily special board, there always a special if your name match the name of day.   Too bad for me, my name beyond uncommon.    Oh well.  I had a few of their sandwiches on another visit, and the Chicago beef was very good, but it was the fries that impressed me.   Yeah, it that kind of place for me, because I will pound some food at this place, and become a honorary Mike Ditka disciple.     If you're from Chicago, this place is home away from home, and my go to spot for deep dish pizza in Las Vegas!

NXJdt-77ijNHOAhPb5NwmA.text: Some of the best pizza I've had since moving out of New York! We had the Chicago-style deep dish pizza, my half had sausage and anchovie, and my boyfriend's half had pepperoni and mushroom. Both tasted great! The sauce is nice and thick, authentic and delicious. They put it on top so all the cheese and toppings stay on the crust.  We also started our meal with the pretzels, which was a mistake. Not because they were bad, they were awesome! Nice and yeasty, just how I like. The cheese sauce was smooth and creamy with just a little black pepper. The problem was that our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we couldn't finish our pizza, no matter how hard we tried.  The hot dogs are good too, but the pizza is where it's at. The lady at the counter was also very friendly and patient while we decided what to get. We've tried a few other pizza joints but we always come back to Windy City!

XjrLs9vMcukp9P7sGW5BWA.text: To preface this review, please keep in mind everyone has different thoughts about what Chicago style pizza is. This review is based on what the majority of Chicagoans consider Chicago Style. First time trying pizza here. I love Chicago style. 5 stars for flavor and service on the phone. Minus 2 stars for the make up of the pizza. I do not consider this True Chicago style. Chicago style is not about how much cheese you can put in it. The cheese and sauce should be about equal. The sauce should have tomatoes that you actually may have to brush off of the top of the pizza. My pizza from here was overloaded with cheese. Very good but, not enough sauce to go with it. The depth was lower than expected. They make it look good due to the cheese pulling away from the rest of the pizza. A good show but, the make up of the pizza was poor. Flavor gets 5 stars. Very flavorful. Girl on the phone was Haley. She was fantastic!! Very nice. Very sweet. Very helpful. Also, their menu shows the largest deep dish pizza is 14 inches. Says on menu 21.50. That is until you put toppings on. I had 4 toppings plus Giardiniera and it was over 31.00. They should have prices on that page for toppings and should also say 21.50. Toppings extra ! I am guessing they have pizzas with certain toppings already added but, guess I did not look around the menu enough to find them. Overall it was a decent experience. I will continue to look for good Chicago style pizza here around Vegas /Henderson. This one was tasty, just not TRUE Chicago. Eating True Chicago style involves one of two things; a slice held in hand should be a mess or you put it on a plate and use a utensil. This can be held in the hand and eaten like any other pizza. And the crust should not be quite as thick as this one was. But, still was very good. In a pinch I may grab another from here.  Thank you Haley!

SiadSS0M5UAlsjtU50OrnA.text: Best Chicago cuisine in the state! The people are awesome so that's a bonus.  Being a True Chicago Chick, I had my doubts. I'm not one of "those" people who say I'm from Chicago and I grew up in Joliet..Lol  So, trust me when I say, best beefs and pizza.   And don't expect ketchup on your hot dog either pally....not here!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the Man himself!!

cMOQt-P-5GpFQh1J4azy9Q.text: Best deep dish pizza I've had in Vegas. The customer service is awesome. They were very engaging and made me feel at home. I'll definitely come back.

BwqApk0d4fENZSHLFnNSKw.text: ermagawd.  I came here with my grad school pal to celebrate the fact that one of us is graduating this semester (not me).  She loves her some Windy City Beefs because she's a Chicago gal and they have the deep dish pizza here.  Plus, everything about this place screams, "I love Chicago!"  Sports banners, posters, pictures are all dedicated to the Windy City--duh.  Michael Jordan looked down on us from the wall as we dined. Did we eat anything remotely healthy?  No.  OK, I had bottled water, Windy City bottled water at that.  And then, there were fries and a shared Chicago deep dish pizza, half cheese and half mushroom.  But, you don't come here to eat healthy.  You come here to eat like Chicago people, which means you're committed from the start, diets be damned.  So, I thoroughly enjoyed the fries and two slices of that deep dish deliciousness--the crust is wonderful!  And then I got stuck with taking home the leftover pizza because my pal said she's on a diet--WTH?!  Guess I'm on a diet again, too.

5vWtXjW1qpSZoj22Z-Spnw.text: I was expecting more based on the reviews. It's a nice little hole in the wall. Prices are average but have to agree that customer service is pretty lousy.

PKsxZMurC-1tO0XoL-dlgQ.text: Cool joint that has deep dish pizza, promising "Chicago-style". My boyfriend's family lives in the Chicago area, so I experienced the pizza there firsthand during Thanksgiving week. That being said, this pizza definitely had a good flavor. But the crust just isn't right. It only took 20 minutes which already made us skeptical because deep dish in Chicago takes 45.  I was told in Yelp Talk that it must be because of the water that they can't make it as thick and "pastry-like", which is a shame. But it was definitely stil good, so I don't wanna diss; I'm sure they tried their best being in the middle of the desert!   I guess I will have to order Giordano's online or go to Chicago to get it the way I want it!

YEHn_kyB-qOR24gszKI60g.text: Every time I get food here it's just plain indulgently delicious. The ingredients are quality fresh and plenty. Highlights was the sauce and large chunks of meat and veggies yum! The deep dish pizza was so heavy I almost had to carry it with two hands. I was intimidated by it when I opened it and could only eat one slice but wow I have to say it just might be one of if not the best pizza I've had here in Vegas.

NcH_pZPi6wrlG0TAvfhaNQ.text: Delicious, the flavors are amazing. I went simple on my first visit and got the deep dish cheese pizza. It was so good. Will definitely recommend.

hPs6IDu4MEbOsZLrhJ4vww.text: We had a large order from them for Superbowl, and they forgot one of our pizza's and had somebody drop it off! Even offered a 50% discount on my next order. RVv3wYToYTVaqX_BFBPN9Q.text: Heard about this place from Natalie K. She liked the wings and staff was pleasant, she has been here multiple times. First impressions are everything, right? Cashier was very rude and wouldn't even give me eye contact, she was short and snappy. I ordered hot wings and fries, she did inform me that the sauce is on the side. Thank you, I then asked for them to be dipped and cooked well done crispy. Wings and fries look great but wasn't as spicy as I would like nor crispy enough. However they were good just not to my personal hot wing liking. I love hot wings

qoiJeo0JJ8nvdqx8HtuWIA.text: For being in a small strip of a larger shopping area, we were surprised by how large Windy City was on the inside.  Lots of tables, and they are spread out so you aren't on top of your fellow diners.  Also, the place was clean, from the dining area to the bathrooms to what I could see of the kitchen.    We had a medium deep dish pizza, which takes about a half hour to cook, so be advised.  We got the meat special (sausage, pepperoni, bacon, beef) and I got some hot giardinera on the side.  This pizza is, in a word, enormous.  We brought it home with us and easily had enough for a second meal.  The crust is flaky and not heavy or doughy.  It definitely contained all of the toppings, which can be an issue with this style of pizza.  The sauce is thick and flavorful, clearly homemade.  The toppings were plentiful and of good quality.  The bacon was probably my favorite, it was thick cut and you get large chunks of it, not tiny chopped up slivers.  It didn't have much heat, so the giardinera was a welcome burst of spice.    At home, heated in the oven it was just as good if not better than it was the day before.  You may balk at the price, but you get a LOT of food, and it's great quality, AND it heats up well the next day.  You can't beat that in my book.

k0_l_LLbp9I3VvbMXdvUFQ.text: Authentic Chicago cuisine. Exceptional. Super friendly staff.   During a 36hr visit to Las Vegas, my wife and I went twice. It's that good. I was born in Chicago so I know when the flavor is tuned properly. This spot has it dialed in.   We had a slice of deep dish sausage pizza. It was perfect. Twice.   We had a Chicago hot dog. It was perfect. (Only ate it on day one ;-)  We had an Italian combo sandwich or 3 as well. Italian sausage smothered in Italian beef. We added medium giardiniera and sweet peppers and had the au jus on the side. Perfection. Beyond great. Damn that was good!   Prices were fair in my opinion. You know that the food was well worth the money when you contemplate paying for a whole 'nother trip just to eat at a restaurant! Yep. That good.   Nuff Said.

2b-WbAMdPUDnAlfvyZf-aQ.text: I really liked their deep dish pizza, though it is a bit expensive it is worth it. My only complaint is there wasn't enough cheese on the pizza and too much sauce. They could be a little bit friendlier at the front desk but whatever. I was reading some comments about them being rude but I just assumed they were more straightforward in Chicago. The lady doesn't give off a friendly vibe but a business vibe, and that's fine.  I love the breading/crust!  It is very thick. It reminds me of Papa Johns breadsticks which I love. The thick crust that is. I haven't tried the thin crust so I can't make comment on that. The thin crust is significantly cheaper, I believe it was like $11 for a small $18 for a small but it is enough for 3 people. Anyways, try the deep dish pizza it is good. The only other "Chicago" pizza I've tried is East of Chicago pizza which is actually one of my favorites. Chicago is pretty good with the pizza. Also which was kind of cool, they have a white board in the front with a name on it, and if its your name they give you a free hotdog. Just a nice thing to do I suppose. Also a good place to watch sports and they have several tvs and a projector which is located in the front.

I will probably go again and give it another chance and update this review.

LnROVKM2oen4CVGChUGa5g.text: I love this place. I think I may have lived in Chicago in a past life, and they serve all of the gteat Chicago comfort foods. Their Chicago hot dogs use Vienna Beef (which is a requirement) and they are reasonably priced! They also have an amazing Gyro and Italian Beef sandwich. Everything is made to order exactly the way you want it. My favorite is the Italian Beef and Chicago Dog combo. It is the best of both worlds!  This is one of those restaurants where I want to try everything on the menu but I always order the same thing because it is amazing.  The ambiance is nice and fits the restaurant perfectly.  Best Chicago food and hot dog joint in the Henderson area!

Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro

tb7ZlhJoVLlGnJB2NXY1zA.text: I've come to love the hot dog that's smothered with their hot dog chili, so much so that the staff working here is telling the line cooks in the back my order as soon as I walk in the door! That's Nina for you!! I don't come here too often, but the employees here greet not only me by first name, but all their regular customers that come in. Very cool and bumped up a star for it.    Anyways like their hot dogs, the chili w/no beans are Vienna Beef brand. Authentic Chicago. I like that the chili sauce is not too spicy and not too thick or runny either.  The #3 also comes with fries in a separate paper bag. They also have pizza at this location..I still have yet to try. One of these days I'll try that corned beef rueben sandwich too!  Most menu items are under $10 for hot dogs and sandwiches. Pretty reasonable. They also still print out a monthly calendar with the daily specials, Or check out the chalkboard in front of register for specials of the day.

LgUtkvkZrn1Ck1Q82z1Ezw.text: Love the decor food was good. Chicago style dogs are always good but bun got soggy too quick.

xKnjJqY8sWBHd3aXNTrI_g.text: Being from Chicago this place is one of the few places that make me feel like I'm home. Food is always good and hot. Biggest reason for 4* is their prices are a little on the high side. Even Portillos is cheaper and way better quality, but Windy City helps me satisfy my cravings. I always will be back anyways! Good to see Jay's chips alive and well.  Review Update: 3*  After coming here for the last 5 years, I decided to try the thin crust pizza. Boy that was a mistake! I got a 16inch thin crust with bacon and pepperoni. Crust and sauce were solid and the best things about this pizza, but the other ingredients just tasted and looked cheap. The bacon especially was disgusting and pure chunks of pork fat, no meat at all. The grease from the pork fat took over the taste of the pizza from cooking. Made me sick feeling like I ate bacon grease only. Cheese wasn't greasy, but melted weird it seemed. I can get past that though I guess. I will not order the pizza again. Steer clear! For $23-$24 many other options out there also. I'll stick to the fries, dogs, and Italian beef and that's it. At least steer clear from the bacon if u really want pizza there. Steep up your game WCB! Use better bacon. Also seems like you hide the bacon on the pizza because it comes out under the cheese, not on top. Afraid to show the quality of the bacon? After you eat one pieces I was like it's just a small piece of fat. It's bacon you know, but every piece was like that. Stay away from their bacon if you really want a pizza there. Expecting rendered down bacon strip pieces is pretty typical to use. I suggest that. If I was eating there I would of sent back my pizza and asked for a refund or just a new plain cheese pizza. At least I wouldn't of gotten sick due to all the grease. I'm born and raised from Chicago and a food & beverage manager here in Vegas the last 5 years. Trust me!

grTFoyW32p8gmbsyNpdeJA.text: I have never had an Italian beef sandwich, but I can tell you for the rest of my life I will compare every one I eat to this one today. I'm a happy girl and will be back very soon. And everyone was so nice, Thank you.  I've been to this place 3 times now and my opinion has only gotten better, I tried the thin pizza this time, the sauce is awesome the crust was beautifully thin and what I call Well done". Next I will try the deep dish and I'm very excited about that. Can I add more stars

XhaeaPyWBFGQHhYZ51TeYA.text: I love the wet Italian Beef. The giardinera on the side makes it perfect too. My friends from Chicago say this is the closest thing to home. It makes me wanna go visit Chicago to compare it. Friendly staff too.

fEUrd5DCLY49ZWooX-EGUw.text: This is NOT Chicago food. It's a sad copycat.  Food was barely edible.  Pizza puff was salty and spicy - two characteristics not in Chicago pizza puffs.  The outer part was not good.  Fries were extremely salty and you have to pay $1.50 extra for cheese for the fries. So not worth it.  The Italian beef was a mess.  Bread was stale and cold, au jus not flavored correctly, cheese was not melted.  A mound of unmelted cheese we sitting on half the sandwich.  Never again.  The best thing was the Sprite.

dO2sEM3rzus43Zgf3yvmCg.text: This place is the bomb.  I love their pizza both thin and deep dish.  Their wings are also incredible.  Heck, all of their food is really good.  I don't think I have had a bad piece of food here.  The walls are adorned with everything Chicago and this is definitely the place to go to watch an Illinois team game while chowing down on awesome food.    They have a special on Saturdays which is any large thin or deep dish pizza with three toppings, 2 drinks, and wings for only $27.  Really a steal when you consider how much food it is.  Try this place.

cVCB5L7-G7NETS_nA0v_Iw.text: There prices are much hire than the Lake Mead location but good food. We went here for dinner pretty slow but great customer service.

L8S9a4pOZqodbR2OmSxb-A.text: So Good! I Picked Up 2 Orders from them in 2 Weeks The first time the Lady was so Cool they where about to Close & I Told her I was just watching some food show with Chicago Beef! She said Sure No Problem! What would you like I Love There Beef & Peppers & I get the Juice on the Side to Dip it in So Yummy! If You are from Chicago You will love it! There pizza is good to but I can not get past the beef

J1BF0uwCitAVBdMwL0Yy5g.text: Awesome Food Excellent Deep deep Dish Thin Crust Just As good  My Only complaint Is That it is Very warm In The restaurant Please fix The Air This is The desert

Jmfq5tANUBXVUBE1sKOtjA.text: Always in search of a True Chicago Dog, I was pleasantly surprised when I discovered this place on our trip to Las Vegas. Walk through the door and you've stepped into a Vienna Hot Dog, Chicago experience. The food was great, service with a smile, the banter between the owner and staff priceless, and the whole experience took me back home.  Had to have the Chicago Dog with fries and a pop (Coke, yes!) and shared the tamale with chili and cheese and of course onion. Both were perfect. Wish I could have had the Italian beef because it looked great and saw many people chowing down on them, but just too much food. Needless to say, I'll come back on every visit to Vegas.

WQwT4n6J80rFNaRHfkMhLQ.text: Idunno what the deal is with the one or two people who say this isn't Chicago style deep dish... this place is right on and they're friggin nuts. Sauce is spot on Giordano's and Lou's, clearly made with the same ingredients and love of Chicago deep dish heritage. So what it's not Uno's? Or Lou's? It's a delicious and unique take on home and I couldn't live here in this shit desert without it.   As is custom with my fav, Giordano's, I always go big with sausage and onion and I must say, as someone who drives three hours to and from Portillo's once a month, the dogs are legit good. They'll hold you over. Maxwell street is delish, too...  so don't be a hater. If you love Chicago you can love this place too. The food is Blackhawk worthy. And cheaper than we're used to pizza-wise.

3rj_yzuxpog_3RtIn73jzQ.text: We are from Chicago and wanted to try this place to have a little taste of home. The Chicago style hot dogs are great tastes just like the ones back home! The fries were good as well. Didn't try the deep dish so can't comment on that. $2 beer deals with Chicago beers was good. They even have green river soda which was awesome.   Only reason for 4* is there is no changing table for a baby in the bathroom which was disappointing.

9W7J7AwB4N3XaIYRON-eag.text: Not the same as Chicago style  When asked question and said that's how it's made in Chicago. Was rudely told this is how the owner likes it and how we sell it  They have their own flare  Staff is not so friendly  Pricey  Not sure if we will return  Order items ahead of time  We waited a long time for hot dogs!! God why can't we have a Portillo's here??

CTfPY0j2IoyxKZSpaLKJzA.text: I think THIS is our favorite restaurant in Henderson. They do delicious food very well. No pretense. Pleasant service and flavorful fare.  My husband loves the deep dish pizza and comes here frequently when we are in Vegas. I just enjoyed the sausage and beef combo sandwich. They accommodated my diet easily. I got tons of delicious grilled onions mixed in with the meats and scooped it out of the roll.   We've been coming here for three years and it's always a highlight of our vacation.

qLLgLureFu_StejLwgloJg.text: Friendly staff.  Yummy fries and Chicago style hot dog.  Hidden away by delicious bundt cake shop.  I'm a ketchup and bun type of hot dog person but this was good.  Fun little place to visit and see the decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

asQUKIA9nhu4Adx3PqQV2Q.text: I live about an hour and a half to 2 hours drive west over a large mountain from here depending on traffic.  I mentioned this to the Woman, who took my order that I was all the way from Pahrump and how much I was really looking forward to having some freshly made Chicago style pizza in a very long time.   The Frozen Deep Dish pizzas from Chicago chains that you can order online for home delivery just aren't that great in my opinion.  I ordered their large Deep Dish and the large thin crust square cut style to go and a bottle of hot Gardinera and then I left to go move my car...I had parked in a bad spot because the parking area was jam packed.  When I came back to pick up my pizzas... the lady at the counter acted oddly, even nervous in fact I thought at the time maybe It was my appearance. She told me she gave me the discount for some current coupon they were accepting that day.  I was all that's great and thank you very much...the 2 pizzas still came to just under $50 dollars in total... but I thought wow! How considerate of her.  When I got back home I was really excited about having some authentic Chicago style food....you just can't get that in this small town I poured a glass of cold beer to celebrate my extra effort of driving all that way.  The verdict:  a God Awful disappointment!!! the deep dish pizza crust was burnt so badly it left a appallingly bitter taste in my mouth a flavor that permeated the whole pizza...The thin crust as well was way over cooked...both ended up in the trash can.  I think I can see why the lady working there was so nervous and gave me a slight discount....very bad form on her part if it was done on purpose.  I wish when they realized they were badly burnt she had offered to make 2 new pizzas and just apologize for the extra wait.  However it's possible it was just a mistake, maybe she didn't know the crust was burnt since the top of the Deep Dish pizza looked great but that shows a lack of quality control at least on this occasion.  To be fair this occurred months ago and I've only been there once and maybe the food and service is normally great and accidents can happen with food.

-zvZXrVwP3oSBpodi-tMAw.text: Don't let the photos on here deceive you. I definitely did. I had never had "Chicago" deep dish pizza before. I decided to try this place because it had great reviews. After trying today, I'm not sure why it does. My pizza was absolutely terrible. The crust was stale, and the cheese and pepperoni was not even cooked all the way. My pizza overall really had no taste either. Unfortunately, never having had deep dish prior to this, I have nothing else to compare it to. However, I still have hope that this place is not a reflection of what real Chicago deep dish pizza is like. Not sure why this place has such great reviews, super disappointing in my honest opinion. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t let the photos on here deceive you. I definitely did. crust was stale, cheese &amp; pepperoni was not even cooked all the way

dRDvAIpQbO63EtysFLV7cQ.text: I just patronized this fine establishment on a recent trip to Las Vegas and was very very very pleased with the great quality of the Italian Beef Sandwhich I had there.  I had mine "dipped" with medium giardiniera sauce.  The sauce was only a three out of five, but the Italian Beef sandwhich itself was an unqualified 5/5.  Jonesing Chicagoans will not be disappointed.

qZjorwc73BYxFq3LOJ0afw.text: Being from Chicago, I know a real Beef and Polish when I taste it. If you like authentic Chicago food and sports vibe, dis is da place!

LaMTBts_LE-hgbbjcpCZAg.text: Great food and friendly staff. I will continue to come back. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of Chicago swag

ow_Yb-4-xUTN-9KDXAoT3w.text: As good as it gets! Awesome prices,great chicago dogs ,beef  sandwiches and deep dish pizza. They always have a special going for a game or event. The staff remembers your name when you walk on and its always great service for take out or dine in. Plus they just got beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish woth extra pepperoni  and hot giardinare peppers

Uo7EDDWRamjPjE6W8HaaDA.text: Not bad at all. Came here today, my husband got the Italian sausage sandwich and I got the Chicago style hot dog. Both came with fries. I liked the flavor. It did remind me of the Windy City. The staff is friendly.

eY-vkeCE8j0Dw_EuIhiKCA.text: The deep dish Chicago pizza is awesome any day. Also try the Chicago beef wet with hot peppers. Awesome.  Same owners as the shop on West Lake Mead.  Worth the trip here for the pizza

hizjXm-YPmfvH-qrI30gBQ.text: Love all the staff here.  I'm here so often the owner asks me if he should start my pizza or sandwich when he sees me in line!  That's service.  The owner Tim always comes out and hugs my mother when she comes in and high fives my kids.  Yeah I'm from Chicago and this place is the real deal!  Vienna beef dogs, S Rosen buns, Neon green relish, celery salt, Tims homemade Italian beef is better than I get in Chi town!   And no, don't put ketchup on a hot dog!

938fyL2cVCWDz4umhS_irw.text: Seriously, this place is doing it right.  Staff is awesome & the food always delivers. Been coming here since shortly after they opened, the second time I came in the older gentleman who I believe is the owner remembered me by name! WOW.   I've had several different things here. Pizza- not from Chicago but I am clearly missing out but I am fortunate to have this place for a slice of pie.  Chicken Fingers- yummy. Nothing special but above average. Chicken Finger Sandwich- This was a special one day & I loved it. Their french fries are pretty darn good too. They also have a nice selection of soda pop (yes I call it soda pop, I am from the east coast) I tried the Black Cherry soda from Dr Browns. Ammmmazing.  Nice to have options when it comes to beverages. The staff is usually pretty friendly & food never takes too long.

6XCF8M4vCOejrX13gdMcQw.text: Overall expected a lot more. Got a thin crust with extra toppings and the pizza was soggy and not something to write home about. We ordered the wings and the same thing.   Sprite was good though

P85TH3LtCE0VoR1WNs903A.text: After several more visits to this fine establishment I feel compelled to provide an update. The place is still good. Love the Chicago style pizza: enough bread and cheese to kill a donkey (to Chi-pizza newcomers this is a good thing).  Two slices and you won't be able to eat for days..... Heavenly.   Only one thing prevents me from giving this place 5 stars: that AWFUL Sammy Sosa jersey hanging on the wall.  Lose that idiot's jersey and replace it with something else.... Bang! 5 Stars!

9tMAGPZDtA67bLwRCVF3og.text: Good deep dish pizza, however I've had better -- Giordanos in Chicago and Zachary's in the Bay Area, California. I would go back since they are literally down the street from me. However they've messed up our orders on 2 separate occasions, not cool since my GF is allergic to certain things..   Sorry guys I won't be going back and will try some of the other Chi-town deep dish pizza alternatives in Vegas.

IclKz5QyFcCDbMHW0_mAIQ.text: Born and raised in Chicago I had high hopes for this place and I wasn't disappointed!  It would have received 5 stars if their Gyro was right off the spit.  The Wings are amazing, their burgers are delish and you can never go wrong with French fries served in a brown bag!!!!   It's a cross town but I will be back to indulge in their pizza next.  Until next time......Peace, Love & Angels

YSbg3mTaA_4Cx25QAcOP1Q.text: Great atmosphere, great deep dish, and fun place for Bears games on Sundays. They have a giant projector that makes watching easy for everyone. Ownership is very involved in the business and puts in an obvious effort to make the experience worth while.

CecUzt2_unbJS0cSyuiKjQ.text: Just tried yesterday for the first time. Passed on the "non Pizza" Groupon which would have brought me in months ago. Finally caved in and took the family for a thin crust pizza. I was really happy with the ingredients and the overall tatse of the pie.    My picky 5 year old had to have the corn dog which was strange because I'm pretty sure he had never had one. It was a corn dog, nothing more, nothing less.    I'll be back to try the beefs next week.

WqGDj3_SJHh6isSruedJHg.text: This place is a fun little hole in the wall.  We came for the pizza.   Beware by the slice has limited hours.   They took a long time so we went to the front to ask and they said they forgot our slices and they were burnt.   We were told we had to wait longer for new slices.   It was a little annoying considering we had already waited a long time.  We watched three other families get there cooked food while we waited for two slices of pizza to be heated up.  Soda is served in styrofoam cups which is a little bit of a turn off to me.  We love that they have paper towel rolls on the tables!   The pizza was really good despite the long wait for slices of pizza that were already made. I would recommend this for tasty food.   The operation needs some improvement if they want to stay competitive.   Can't wait to try more another time.

317SYow7FjhNvaU-mheotQ.text: I LOVE AND MISS THIS PLACE SO MUCH!!!!!  My husband and I lived in Las Vegas these past two years and before that we were born and raised in Chicago. When we moved to Las Vegas we found this place right away! And WOW! It's just like being at home!!! Best hot dogs and sandwiches in Las Vegas! I can't get enough of their Chicago Dogs and their chili cheese dogs! Their Ruben and their Italian beef sandwiches are amazing too!! You just can't go wrong with anything you order here!

kVNZHysLJ_QOzIAcBZ6u7A.text: Came here with the pizza posse. I've always been a die hard Chicago style pizza lover (and hot dog too). My first stop in Chicago is Gino's, Lou's, Portillo's and Hot Doug's. Yes I will eat all in one day. I love a good, flaky crust. This pizza had a great crust, along with big meaty pieces of tomato. The kicker, they have giardineira. YES I love giardineira on my pies, but I wasn't in love with the brand they carry. My only complaint is the pizza could have been left in a tad longer, the sauce was on the lukewarm side. Since it is deep dish, plan to wait 45-60mins for it to cook. We passed the time by splitting a hot dog. They are pretty small, but perfect for an appetizer. I do realize I'm not in Chicago so I'm not gonna get all crazy and compare them to the real deal, but this can definitely suffice in between my trips. Try the frozen cheescake for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large pie. Half onions &amp; mushrooms (Jamie W&#39;s half) &amp; half giardinera (all mine)

HRGjKe-3xqsq6aIELxcFkA.text: I have never had Chicago deep dish pizza before. I had to miss Michael K.'s UYE here a couple of weeks back. So after work one day I was craving pizza. I asked one of my coworkers who comes from Chicago to come with me.   What we ended up getting for $35 was ridiculous. An order of wings with fries and a large pizza with the works was too much food for two grown men. In fact, we finished the wings and barely got through a slice before tapping out. Deep dish is no joke. The crust is not dense or doughy and held up to all the moisture that the veggies released. When they say the works, they mean it. Each slice is layered with massive amounts of ingredients. Ours basically had everything from their line.   Don't worry, when you pack it up to go, it only gets better the next day.

mKEy5lqQ2d0x-Tn_heLK9w.text: Everything was great. Pizza was phenomenal. The wings were crunchy, golden brown  deliciousness...if you're a fan of pizza, you gotta go here, and definitely get the Chicago deep dish

AFwNqI40z1M1BFpJ9vcnsQ.text: Always our go to pizza joint near home. Wings are great...no breading. Deep dish is excellent; I  dare you to eat three slices in one sitting. Thin crust is good too, but better in the restaurant, the crust gets a little greasy on delivery

WJGP_2bIoctay6EPQqOIvg.text: This place is awesome My girlfriend and I have been searching for a all around pizza joint and this is it lol. the wings are fantastic there perfectly cooked and to be honest they don't even need sauce that's how u know  there good lol the deep dish is excellent has a mildly sweet tomato sauce but is very bold in flavor, the crust is my Ideal crust it's crunchy but still chewy lol it's pretty bomb!! Along side the great food was the staff there super friendly and gave us attention as soon as we walked in wouldn't change a thing

WpZlIDoeci83R6Jd2uh1PQ.text: Really enjoy eating here at lunch with my co-workers. We are always treated great by the folks that work here, and the food has never let us down. I have had the pizza, hot dogs, gyro, and chili fries, all are great but I always go back to the greatest sandwich at this place, the good ole number 13 combo, Italian beef and sausage combo, wet with cheese. Everything about this sandwich is great, from the flavor of the Italian beef and sausage, to the fluffiness and magic of the bread. Only complaint is the decor, way to much Bears crap on the walls, gives me a head ache, SKOL VIKINGS!!! Haha

r85H8INpsMeQQ1hu-VizFg.text: I found this gem and tried it out thanks to a Groupon. Best. Deal. Ever. Because now I have a favorite pizza place close to my home.   The deep dish is delicious, even better than the "authentic" deep dish pizzas that I have eaten in Chicago. Windy City Beefs N Pizza does everything right: sweet crust, delicious sauce, inches of cheese, loaded with toppings (try the sausage, you will thank me).   While waiting for your order, the Chicago memorabilia that decorates the walls is a great way to pass the time (and keep your mind off your growling stomach).

fk93AJ4IitrR7M_rWwXadA.text: Went here on a Thursday morning to try their hot dogs because I've been eyeing this place for awhile. I walked inside and no one greeted me.. I was the one that greeted them, and no one replied.   When I eat hot dogs, I just like it plain. Literally just the bun and the hot dog inside. & that is the same case with my cousins. Then we'll have all the ingredients on the side to put in our hot dogs so we can control the ingredients that we want to put. But this is the ONLY hot dog place I know that can not give a PLAIN hot dog. They said they can't put it on the side when the ingredients are removable. Apparently she said that it has to be on it and I did not hear it so I came to her and told her I thought everything was on the side, so she gave off a rude vibe and said she already told me once that it has to be on the hot dog.  Needless to say no one ate the hot dogs. My cousins only ate the fries. Customer service is okay,- and the ambiance is good. I'll probably go back to try their pizzas and give it another try.

zOnaR7dWxEw5oOu2WNwZgg.text: This place is GREAT for Chicago style pizzas. I did their carry-out deep dish and I couldn't have been more pleased. I also their Chicago style hotdog, they use Vienna Beef which I like the most but overall the hotdog was so-so. However, where their hotdog lacked, the pizza made up for it and more. It was nice and thick with long amazing stretching cheese with each bite. The crust was cooked perfectly and complemented the pizza perfectly. I am able to usually eat 3 or 4 slices of pizza, but I was only able to take down 2 slices of Windy City's because it was loaded nicely. This place is definitely a new go to for pizza for me and gets a solid 5 star rating for their pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep crust pizza with pepperoni and double mushroom

XJ-r5DAcEJmNh3DLMgJaVQ.text: The new king of Chicago style deep dish pizza in Las Vegas!  In my quest to find the best Chicago style pizza I try to taste any establishment that offers True deep dish pies. I stumbled upon Windy City while browsing Yelp (hooray!) and am I glad I found it!  Windy City is located on a nice corner with a small plaza out front. The interior is spacious and casual with Chicago memorabilia.  On to the important stuff: Chicago style deep dish pizza. Best I've tried in Las Vegas.   The crust is thick enough to hold the toppings and has an amazing buttery taste. The sauce is definitely a highlight, tangy, sweet and flavorful, next time i'll order some extra sauce to use on pasta! The cheese is creamy and tastes very fresh. If you order additional toppings you can rest assured the guys at Windy City don't hold back, they just pile the toppings! As always if you order a deep dish pizza, give it at least 10-15 more minutes than a traditional pizza. Good (and big) things take time...  The service is great, I was greeted with a smile and the staff was very pleasant to deal with.

NAmgdERpkxwkbMZ2o_TXwg.text: Well I went there the other night just after 10.pm 4 a cannoli The counter girl "oh is that all you having?!" I ask how big are they she answered regular size with a WHATEVER! attitude. Never really make eye contact with me ! Multitasking. ... I don't think so just felt kinda like I was a broke ass dude . 10 seconds later the cannolis ready .. well went we star eating was soggy not fresh . One the worst I ever had . I may return to have a deep dish pay and give them a chance to earn some stars......

jv5dCGZ-I-VZLAKWuuDI4A.text: Sometimes I feel like all I'm doing with my life is waiting. Waiting for the next job, the next promotion, the next relationship, the next benchmark that will forever sever gestation from the accolade, the rehearsal from the remuneration. And I was made vividly aware of this when I placed an order with Windy City Beefs N Pizza and had to wait for the Chicago style pizza delivered fresh to my door. It wasn't a long wait or anything, but I wondered, would I always be waiting? For my driver's license, for graduation, for my first real job, my wedding, my children, my mortal demise? Is it even possible to transcend?  Maybe we should embrace the now. Maybe it's time to stop longing for Summer, 2008 and seize the day in Las Vegas. Sure, the pizza is almost nothing like Chicago's Pizzaria Uno or Giordanos, but maybe that's the way life is meant to be, and the pleasures of Chicago are, like all things, ephemeral. And maybe it's time to stop waiting, stop wining that the world gave you mashed potatoes when you really wanted french fries, accept the hand you're dealt and play it like a man! And also, eat the pizza N beefs.

okr6uXz3lXD6MmgTsEYCQg.text: Being from the midwest Illinos at that you miss the chi pizza's and chi dogs,this place will make you remember why you love deep dish pizza and chicago dogs! There are many places that say they are chi style and are just merly imitating but not at the qualtiy of what chi style pizza and dogs are! This place seems like someone just picked it up from chicago and planted them where thery are here in vegas! The customer service is great they are friendly and they have 3 groupon offers to pick from i have bought all three nore than once, their hot wings are amazing as well! They have a thing where each day if your name is the one that's posted you get a free hotdog, i know mine will never be posted but i am okay with that...lol! They have dine in or take out, and they even have an option where you can but all the authentic stuff to make your own chi dog at home. The prices are reasonable and the quality is great. The portions are good and you feel welcomed when you are in there.

Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best chicken wings ive had since ive been in vegas chi town knows hiw to make a wing not pictured is the hot wing sauce
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maxwell polish they way its meant to be made

jJwZ_HtF2FU-8I27NuVR2Q.text: After visiting Chicago last summer, whenever I have the chance to get an Italian beef I jump at the opportunity.  Visiting Vegas for an AAU basketball tourney. We came across this spot and got excited. I must say this spot is pretty official. The beef and the Au jus is spot on and the peppers combo are spicy forming a perfect combination. If you are in that area you need hit that spot if you can't make it to Chicago.

vLd3AoFx4OaXhQhEybRf_w.text: Had eaten here once and liked the food even though it was super crowded on a game night. Thought it would be a great place for client needs and called the restaurant to speak with a manager or owner. Whoever answered the phone had the worst customer service personality I've ever had to deal with. She apparently wasn't a manager or owner but felt she had the authority to shoot down any business I might want to send their way. Finally she says to email and the owners or managers would call. I asked for the email address and she says go to the website. Frustrated I say thank you and hang up then call back to find out who I'm supposed to address my email to. She says "to whoever" and I say "so there isn't a person with a name that can help me" and she says "I'm not authorized to give that information out". I ask "you're not authorized to give me a managers name" and she says "just email and if they're interested they'll have a look". I ask if I'm bothering her by trying to send customers her way and rather than change her tone she just says "no not at all". Unbelievable. Will never come back. Good hot dogs aren't worth crappy service.

DMgRLH6pB9xO6624DbbnHg.text: I had the number 4 (half beef sandwich and a Chicago hot dog) with their hot pepper mixture, the only gripe I have is that their hot peppers were a medium at best. The food otherwise the food was great, the service was great and they have a small but decent selections of beers to pair which was a nice relief from the normal strip mall bud or bud light. I'll definitely return!

np72FCjq09ZJXMwQOzZ2iA.text: Food is great. This review isn't about the food. It's about the woman cashier. She is rude and she has a thing for making people feel stupid, apparently. I wanted a slice of pizza, but she very rudely pointed up at the menu and said that it was only available on weekdays. Sorry I couldn't see the really small print! And besides that, I think that's ridiculous to only serve slices on weekdays. And anything else I asked about, her answers were rude and short. I felt very rushed. Her attitude was terrible and it seems like she just wanted us gone, even tho it was barely busy in there. After looking at a few reviews on here, I see that a lot of other people complained about her too. You're in customer service, learn how to be polite and treat people! Also, if you hate your job so much then please consider one that isn't in customer service.

SKcseX7mgF2TdIeYUSuf-w.text: Ok so I contacted the business and we were erroneously charged a delivery charge, not for a tip. The owner Dakota said to come back in and we would have a credit waiting for us, True to their word and then some!  We are waiting for our deep dish pizza right now! Great that they corrected their error and made good on the promise, highly recommend this place!!!

6gO5UtwQYY_Loi-guvbrqA.text: What can i say. Great hospitality and great food. This will be one of my favorite spots when i visit vegas!!!

EVinIC8KKAyt-jgYr4BjRA.text: The Italian beef is absolutely to die for.  I'll try it extra hot next time.  Have also had the hot dog "with everything", it was good.  I'm not much of a hot dog fan, but had the $3.99 special so I tried it.  Will have to try the pizza next time.  Great place.

8ViFGh4AZg3QNlmeFdGyPA.text: Best chili cheese tamales w onions. Best Italian beef w spicy giadernia (sp.). Bomb fries and great hot dogs. You cannot go wrong eating here!  Ps. grab a papaya boba slush next door to compliment your meal.

l_l7IPeL_mF6gIfat5rPXg.text: This review is based off of my first visit where I ordered the sausage beef combo and a tamale on side. I thought it was absolutely delicious! This is a place where you don't want to share! Other visitors ordered the pizza and it to looks delicious. They have a calendar with daily specials. I will definitely return to try one of the specials. The price point was a little high, but visit with a coupon and you will be just as pleased as I was.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. January 2015 specials.

dHeNJVpyRMPF_Sik3_rj_w.text: Been here twice now and both experiences were excellent. Now I'm not a expert in Chicago style hot dogs but they were delicious! Definitely going to be returning. Also prices were cheap for the quality of the food.

DWOLdnSkSS5JlVzjdis7sQ.text: If you understand the concept of Chicago themed food than you'll be in for a treat.  This is the closest you can come to enjoying a Chicago hot dog, beef sandwich, and even deep dish (in the Henderson/South LV area)  without having to road trip it to Portillo's in Az or Ca.

hz1QW4s2Lq3J4gMFOf_z_g.text: Deep dish was really, really great! In my opinion, it was much better than the  Giordano's I got in Chicago.   I also liked the memorabilia on the walls there -- nice touch.  Lastly, I never had a cannoli before, so I can't compare, but it was delicious as well!  The only negative I can point out is that the "salad" was not much of a salad at all--wife and I just used it as burger toppings the next day.  If you're in Las Vegas and want a pizza, this is well worth the short trip. Maybe five miles south on LV Blvd and then a few miles east on Silverado and you're there. Very easy to get to, even for a tourist.

8x2m929Lc0DcY-nbV1CDTA.text: Oh my gosh, this has to be the BEST pizza outside of Cook County! We have eaten here numerous times and it's always fresh, hot and delicious. They have great beer and dog combos, and even pop and dog combos. The prices are extremely reasonable for authentic Chicago food. I will definitely be back here, many many times!

AojZ3jstT1JS6cwBwdn5ZA.text: Overall the experience was ok.  The Chicago dog was good, but not grilled which i prefer.  Fries were standard frozen fries so nothing to write home about.  The beef dip however was something to come and try.  I got the mild version and still had plenty of zing on it.  Overall if you are looking for a hotdog this a good spot to try.

seJVqkibSeY6TiAfqFPN8g.text: Wow... really liked this place until now. The last time we ordered from Windy City we asked for extra light sauce and after getting home the pictures show the sauce dripping off the pizza. I called and sent the photos too them and Mudana was very nice said we will replace it or your next is free either way. I was fine with that. Called tonight and Nina "manager" informed me that their employees are not authorized to give me a new pizza but she "guesses" she'll honor it since it was in the notes when I called.  Nina acted as if it was my problem that their employee offered good customer service. Needless to say, I said no thanks I'd rather go somewhere else that values their customers and employees for taking care of their mistakes.

9Ul-sTv14eydwvTK7zxW7g.text: The food alone I would give five stars because I'm from Chicago but every time I've ordered something from this location, they screw up the order. They need to get better at listening to the customer when placing the order and making sure everything is correct before they let the customer leave. Please train the employees better.

nnaccjXbbnD9gAw-qdkqNg.text: I'm sorry Chicagoans', it's not my thing. Hubby got us a couple Chicago dogs with fries. I liked the bun and the fries, but that was about it. I don't like the thick skinned hot dogs they sell and they don't have much flavor. Hubby ate the rest of my dog, he digs them. Service was good, restaurant was clean and comfy, nicely decorated with Chicago sport teams.  I won't go back but it's just my taste preference.

94Zo8a5i_NT3agb8Yj6Zjg.text: The deep dish pizza is well worth the price of admission. It takes way way way too long so call so call ahead. The location is a bit of a struggle and the place is a little lacking in ambiance.

LeWF7_9hDxlSXcKCq0_H7A.text: In short - really good Italian beef (strongly recommend getting it wet), passable Chicago deep dish, but thought the hot dogs were overdone.  +1* for being a local independent spot and have always found the servers friendly. Plus love the decor with all the memorabilia and vintage pics / newspaper postings.  Bottom line is that if I need a deep dish fix and don't want to go to the Strip (and wait forever there) for Giordano's, this place will get the job done.  Tip: If you get deep dish takeout, bring a big garbage bag or tray to put the pies in so the oil runoff doesn't spill in the car.

GS2qTEF0Fvmj3Loq5khaXQ.text: Not sure if this place has new owners, but they have gotten so bad with the servings of their food. I ordered a hot dog with fries, and the hotdog was smashed and not even half bag of fries. O and don't order extra gravy for your dry beef sandwich they will charge you. I am giving up on this place.

Ttq0AZ_6QWORapFJRIGuGw.text: My husband and I recently moved to Nevada so we're trying out new places to eat. This is one of our top favorites. The price was really good for what we got. We ordered the deep dish pizza with wings. The wings were okay, but we loved the pizza. We prefer our pizza with a lot of meat and they did a great job of adding a lot of the toppings and cheese, will for sure be going back soon!

yGVunMn5tGghmmJ4EeCFeA.text: 4 stars only because there is a charge to get a splash of giardiniera for my Italian Beef Sandwich. The sandwich was tasty, the beef was good, the bread was almost on par with Chicago Italian bread I got when I was a kid. The search for the "right" Italian Beef Sandwich is long and hard. This find was close. Very close.   The staff is very friendly. While it was a damp night outside, it was comfy inside. I always have a high expectation for an IBS, and they would be very high on my list of "must go." I probably could have eaten a larger sandwich, but I left satisfied. More recent reports (my Chicago cousins stopped in) are that the quality is still on the high side. I might need to make a stop next time I'm in Vegas to see if it's still on par.

usdZ-rag2FR_ancNhULJjQ.text: The absolute best pizza in town!! The staff is friendly and the decor makes you feel like your in a little place in Chicago.

2tWIhtMv6icWlytb3y6vSA.text: Favorite place to go.  The only problem is deciding which of my favorite foods to order. Pizza is outstanding beef sandwiches are perfect.  My son could live on the tamales.  Don't forget the hot dogs also. Staff is the friendliest you will ever meet.

apw5Hxcuz8eoKBMpzyTuVg.text: I highly recommend the #10 - Windy City's Chicago Style Italian Beef Sandwich; Dipped!  This sandwich definitely reminds me of Chicago Italian Beef sandwiches...so DELICIOUS!

Dbj6seIzxxr697XJMK4gew.text: I had a craving for a Chicago Dog. I remember when this location opened, and had quickly bookmarked this for a later date. Well, I am glad that I did.  Living in Illinois for nearly 20 years, I came to love the hot dogs there. I am weird, and get mine without onions or the neon green relish. I just can't do it. We decided on our order, and then we just stood there waiting for a moment. And continued to wait while the lady behind the register finished up stapling and organizing her previous tickets. When she finally said something, she was animated and friendly.   My husband chose the Italian Beef with the spiciest peppers and 'wet'; and I of course chose my 'Chicago dog, 'not' Chicago dog and fries. They came out fairly quickly. The sandwich and the hot dog were both wrapped in paper, and the fries had their own little bag, which was twisted closed.   The fries were thin, and fairly tasty but were not piping hot. My hot dog tasted like I remember them to be, and the Beef was good. Next time, he said that he would choose to have it dipped rather than just wet. This way it will be nice and messy! Yum. As I was getting ready to leave I noticed that they sell large bags of Jay's Potato Chips. Are you serious?! I could not get over there fast enough to buy a bag. The price on the bag is exactly what I paid. That right there made my whole day. I have not had those for 17 years, and they were just as I remembered them to be.

EYZsEHl1P68z-Ln5xzr0aw.text: We love this place! Always friendly service, great food, and a place to hang with family. They usually always have affordable specials (especially $2 beers with Knights games and when any Chicago team is playing.

43pS8ATD8Rex0AHf3kkd1w.text: Wow!! I'm originally from Chicago born and raised. Look this place up on Yelp, had my doubts. But I must say this place has the beef and deep dish pizza hands down great. I'm really glad I stopped in while I was here on vacation from the ATL. Great job guys!! Keep up the good work until I visit again Good Luck to you!!

rDAf8D7_FwA77Dx_wdywag.text: If I could give 1000000 stars I would. You CANNOT find a better Italian beef sandwich anywhere else! THE BEST ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICH IN LAS VEGAS! The thin crust pizza is to die for! The sauce has the perfect amount of sweetness! Their friend fries taste just like McDonald's! The people are always amazing! Honestly I can't say enough great thing about this place.

hGze1ikjy72BkJmy1vLY4Q.text: I have been coming to this location and the one in Summerlin for some years now. We are from Chicago. I just left from picking up an Italian beef and fries to bring home for lunch. The beef did not taste of the high end quality that I usually taste and I'm not so sure why they are super stingy with the fries.  I probably will still go back because this is the first time I was not 100% satisfied....will purchase an extra order of fries for now on.

6rjih4qqSxvQmop9n5xvtg.text: If you are coming to Windy City Beefs N Pizza on a day a Chicago sports team is playing, be prepared for a crowded restaurant.  I came in yesterday around noon and Da Bears were playing.  There was a big projector screen and several TVs all showing the game.  The restaurant was nearly at capacity with only a very few open seats.  It wasn't terribly rowdy but there was a fair amount of noise coming from the fans and TVs.  For these reasons I decided I would take my lunch to go.  I ordered a #10 dipped with medium giardiniera. That is to say an Italian beef sandwich dipped (submerged) in au jus (gravy I believe they call it) with added medium spice pickled vegetables.  I had a craving for one of these sandwiches for months.  It was worth the wait.  When you order a dipped sandwich, it comes out incredibly soggy.  Clearly a result of being dunked like carnival clown in a tank.  It is nearly impossible to eat.  That is if you try to eat it like a regular sandwich.  You will go through napkins like crazy as the juice drips down your arm and all over the table.  The added vegetables give a much needed crunch to this otherwise soft sandwich.  Not to mention the spice and zing of the brine.  It all comes together as something wholly desirable.  My go to sandwich from a place like this.

c3TwaDcrV4S2rW9SdNbY2A.text: Wow what a fantastic place to eat. We enjoyed their delicious Pizza and also had the terrific Chicago Vienna Hot Dog. I took home the Italian beef sandwich and the Italian sausage sandwiches and enjoyed the hell out of them. I'll be back soon for some delicious Chicago food !!!

0BT7j8dySAPEYMwBopB06Q.text: There deep dish pizza is to die for, reasonable price too. This is one of our favorites now!

wuRJ96v3qXEBRJ6sgqtyxg.text: Had the thin crist pizza. Was not impressed with the sauce. Not up to Chicago standards in my opinion. May be a little overrated.

E4IXdYxYw3ScOxUFwNYxWA.text: I've never lived in Chicago, but I love love love their traditional eats. Pizza, beef sandwiches, and hot dogs - yum! Windy City serves up all those staples, plus a few extras like chicken wings and sausages.  We came in on a Saturday for lunch and they had a steady stream of customers, but we had no problem finding a table. We ordered a pepperoni thin crust, an italian beef, and a side order of fries. All were good. The beef was delicious - lean and plentiful - no fat blobs here! We ordered with cheese, sweet peppers, and giardinera (sp?), which was pretty spicy for medium. I don't think a baby like me could handle the hot. The pizza was a good, solid pie, and the leftovers tasted great the next day, too. I'll have to come back to sample the deep dish. Surprisingly, the fries were very good, sprinkled with some kind of a seasoned salt and plenty crispy. They have lots of specials, like half price Fridays (I think), 50-cent wing Wednesdays, and a couple other ones I forget. Prices are definitely reasonable - our pizza, beef, fries, and 2 drinks came to about $26. For dessert, you can go next door to Nothing Bundt Cakes or on the other side of the parking lot to Freed's. The atmosphere inside is very welcoming to families - no liquor license (at least not yet), and lots of kids running around.

rXAT2ei7DnpPHmNyniv9Dg.text: If there were no stars to give that's what I would give. I've been in Henderson for about a little over a month now. Trying to get used to the food differences here had been difficult to say the least. Finally I came across what I hoped would be a piece of home. Born and raised in Chicago I thought, great let's see what this place is about. On moving day after a very long day of moving I ordered pizza, fries and wings. This place is only 3 miles from my home and this simple order took more than 2 hours to get to my home then of course was cold! Too tired and disgusted from what was a long day of moving. I wasn't in the mood to argue and decided I will never order from here again. Then the manager called on her own to apologize the next day and offer a discount on our next orders. I said wow! That's great! Thank you. That's a really nice gesture you're saying to yourself. Well yes i5 thought so too. Then! I decided today to place my second order ever here. A deep dish pizza, half sausage/half cheese and fries. They delivered the pizza and fries, remembered who I was and said sorry we disappointed you the first. Ok, no problem. I get everything ready for us to eat our deep dish that we've been waiting an hour for (typical for deep dish), open the box and its a THIN CRUST SMALL MUSHROOM PIZZA. What is wrong with these people! Am I being punked right now??? Now after complaining to them I have to wait for another pizza to arrive so AGAIN my pizza will take 2 hours to get here. I'm done. This is just ridiculous and the cashier had the AUDACITY to say they wouldn't charge me for ANOTHER pizza. REALLY!!

JBv2bxp_h1BgPk0-76h1hw.text: I've been craving some chicken wings lately and found this place on Yelp with a lot of good reviews, decided to give it a try. It's bigger than it looks from the outside and there were probably around a dozen people dining inside on a Sunday evening.  Woman at the counter and guy who later handed me my food were stone faced and not very welcoming. A little over $10 for a dozen wings. They came out almost instantly, which sounds good, but means they were probably sitting under heat lamps.   In the car they didn't even smell good, like old grease. They tasted a little better than they smelled, but nothing special. Came with a side of also very greasy fries. Their hot sauce is Frank's, and their medium tastes like Frank's diluted with ranch.   I may come back to try their beef sandwich or pizza, which is their main deal, but not for wings.

TDOVEV91QYUEnahPqxK52Q.text: Best Chicago deep dish pizza and combination italian beefs for sure. Nice place to sit and enjoy the games.

aklKnxfVmdgFtmC4LjpljQ.text: This place feels so much like Chicago, I almost feel like I have the need to throw on a thick mustache and aviator sunglasses. The food's great and it feels like home, and even better than that is the service. They make you feel important by at least trying to remember your name, even if it's the second or third time heading over there. I'll always come back!

pHR0ZrD2U3ZgOEclgRS5XA.text: Excellent chili dogs, fries, & corn dogs, gotta try the pizza next. Fun old school pizza parlor atmosphere & really friendly staff. Top notch all around, recommended.

NAQc2L--LIIltc9WThSmtg.text: Had the Italian beef sandwich & it was awesome. This place has the best Chicago food here. I'm from there and this place reminded me of all the good food I was missing out on. I will be going here every week now, it's that good!!!

vZBtlMsFwfA3c-xo1YmgEg.text: Just like home! Real Chicago food! Hotdog beef sausage yep they have it all! The eastern location has pizza too  I you need a fix of Chicago's best, Wind City Beef and Pizza has my vote!   Real Chicago native run! They understand the urge

AaNZdsHAPpm_hqJ76KJXPQ.text: Almost every time we come visit our friends in Henderson we try to stop at Windy City to go back to our love for Real Chicago style hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches (dipped) & deep dish pizza. The food is great, service great & they always have a game on!  This place rocks!!!

dB5AGyGd8ZVwE4dZOdb9gA.text: Great pizza, the deep dish is awesome! Love all the Bulls decor. They also sell 312 beer. Kids loved the hot dogs

NNGpik0QDb65on9oZjVC1w.text: Though I love the pizza and hot dogs here, today I tried and did not like anything about the Italian beef sandwich. They dip the entire sandwich in au jus which made it totally impossible to pick up as the bread was mush and fell apart. The meat was not tender or flavorful either YUCK! ...so disappointed.

Hnxgs5MJSReEgyIQd9oHJg.text: Being from Chicago, it took me a long time to find good Chicago type comfort food such as authentic chicago hot dogs, maxwell polish, Italian sausage/beef/combo sandwiches, thin crust pizza and deep dish pizza.  We found out about this place at their first location up by Summerlin and was bummed out when we moved out to Henderson. You can imagine the excitement we got when this location opened up and also served PIZZA. They even have pizza puffs and tamales (All they need now are Chicago Ribs-lol)  This place definitely hits the spot for your Chi-town faves.  The place is a good size (largest of the other locations) and is decked out with Chicago memorabilia.  So, if you want a taste of Chicago, they do it very well along with a few other "Chicago" inspired restaurants in town...this just happens to be in my neighborhood.

AiW6Wbuf5dc1sa55shOKiw.text: Really casual place with really great food.  I really love the concept and appreciate that its a family business.  If you know anyone looking for a part time job, have them drop off a resume.  While the lady that manages the place is great, you can tell its an uphill battle for her trying to manage the goons in the kitchen.

KqqV7toEizU96xkl9BKkQA.text: This place has the best deep dish pizza I've ever had!

EgzWUXwotvpQACaAWQpKsQ.text: The price is reasonable and deep dish pizza is by far the BESt pizza we ever tasted. People are so friendly and fast service.  LoVe this Place. Definitely recommend this to my friends and family.

wMnlNNOUDsIbYTmiToSzGQ.text: Wow.. just wow.  This place is amazing..  Their deep dish pizza is out of this world delicious. I had the 14 inc with pep and sausage. The sauce and the crust are just untouchable. This is now my favorite pizza in the entire valley.   The service was also really good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The environment of this place is also really cool. Just a very chill and relaxed place to stop in and have a great meal.  The last notable mention is that the prices are also really good. The deep dish came out to around 20 and easily fed three people with an extra slice left over.. Damn good way to spend twenty bucks.

Tyul3xaFqG5iwD6_Fb_ymA.text: Sad face, happy stomach. Windy City Beefs and Pizza is where I go to get a taste of Chicago. The atmosphere looks like the spots I grew up eating at. The food is great, the staff are from the "city" and you can tell that many of the other guest hail from Chicago as well. I had the Italian Beef dipped. WHOA!

fQ6NO9Yg7hXMIKvgBZWs4A.text: First time here, very happy with the pizza. I have been to Chicago but have never had a deep dish, so I couldn't tell you if it was authentic or not. What I can say is that it was very good. Not too greasy, nice and filling, very tasty. Sauce tastes home made, which is a big plus. We had a groupon, which made everything free! Well, it worked. We will surely be going back to support this business with real money, asap :)

HtaONAVERA6M0Do8ASbccA.text: Great food. Eating there made me feel like I was at home in Chicago.  Nena is awesome.  Even got some food to go for my mom. Love this place!!!! Will most definitely be coming back!!!!

c__Q_HJ3g12w_hx7UYigpQ.text: Can we say totally delicious! First of all, my fellow midwestern people will not be disappointed in huge bags of Jay's for sale! Yummy!! The pizza was delicious, and I'd like to say I am seasoned when it comes to pizza. It was clean, decorated with all types of Chicago paraphernalia and a great dining experience. Sean, Dakota and Abraham were very pleasant and we will definitely return. It's nice to go into a place that makes you feel great before and after you leave. Lastly, the Giardiniera is definitely worth writing home about. I can't wait to go before 4 pm to take advantage of the specials they have during the day (hence, slice of deep dish pizza and pop for $5 on Mondays!) or $1.50 Chicago dogs on Tuesdays! Thank you Windy City Beefs and Pizza!!!

m8vs05ATVJkgcYoxCTWrZw.text: I had the two Chicago dogs and fries. It delivered on having an authentic style hotdog with all the traditional windy city fixings. Price was fair and portion was good even for a big fellow like me. I loved the celery salt on the dog, it gave that extra pop to go with the tomatoes and sport peppers. Can't wait to try their pizzas!!

cSwQ8DvPjh0oroHxzMF7Qg.text: I'm from Chicago and this place felt like back home. Walk in and everything is Chicago.. hotdogs we're Chicago style and fries were good. New favorite place :)

exsOWbxs9JM3NSB5TO_Paw.text: FYI Grand Opening is today & all dine-in orders are 50% off 1/25/13 til 10pm! Why are you still reading this, go there now! This is an update for a multi meetup event on 1/17/13. If you look at the pics I posted (the ones with the signs that say what each pizza is) you will see an amazing variety of pies.   The owners Tim and Dakota were very accommodating, they met with our organizers a week prior to discuss the setup and what we expected. Even though they do not have salads on their menu, they went out of their way to provide us with a large tossed salad so we could have it served with our pizzas. Our group had it set up as "communal style" so we can try several different pizzas and there is something for everyone. Tim and Dakota set up some tables near the front and set it up buffet style, and brought out a couple different pizzas every 15 or 20 minutes so that the food was hot during the event.   They had plenty of tables set up for our group of 32+ people, and there was plenty of room to move around and socialize. Their waitstaff was attentive and came over several times during the course of our event to check on us. We went to the counter to order our own beverages. They also allowed us to bring in beer and wine since their liquor license is not in yet.   Everyone in the group was happy and it was a very fun time, nice atmosphere. Nice flat screens are on the walls and the room is brightly lit. Very positive feedback from all, I did not hear one complaint which is huge (because there is always one in every crowd).   Here is what we ordered: Thin Crust:  Ultimate Veggie (green pepper, onion, mushroom and tomatoes)  Sausage Classic (sausage, green pepper, mushroom, onion)  White Pizza (olive oil, ricotta, garlic, tomatoes)  Cheese  Pepperoni/Bacon  Pepperoni  Deep Dish:  Cheese [note: this was REALLY GOOD!!! Cooked perfectly, gooey cheese, delicious sauce, oh my!!!] Sausage/Onion  Meat Special (Sausage, Pepperoni, Ground Beef & Bacon)  WCBPN Loaded (Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Mushrooms, Onions, Green Peppers & Black Olives)  Ground Beef/Mushroom  FYI they don't have the NBA or Ice package but when your sports games are on regular TV this is a great place to watch some sports. I will be back with a group to watch the Chicago Bulls and Blackhawks games because it IS "Windy City pizza!"

HAthfnEK0Tq5LuJtyyGphQ.text: Just moved to Nevada from Illinois. Have had a few different pizza places and we just haven't had that great of a pizza until we came here! It was excellent almost tasted like we would get back home. Would  recommend to others so good! Can't wait to come back and try more from menu.

V8c16lqY13bGJqxFPfYuMA.text: I've been to their other location on Lake Mead for hot dogs and beefs but when I heard that this one had deep dish pizza I just had to check it out. I love deep dish pizza and have been unable to find any places in Vegas that compare to the ones I've had in Chicago. Long story short, the pizza here is deceiving and should in no way be called deep dish. It is simply a normal pizza with thicker, flakier crust! The good news is that the pizzas and cannolis are made fresh because it took a while for each item to be made and brought to my table. The cannolis were ok...I've definitely had much better ones elsewhere. I guess my search for authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza continues...

bXlUzOqPrN2mU4YKXorh-A.text: Normally I would only eat hotdogs at a BBQ and only if there was nothing else to eat. I HATE hotdogs. But my husband was craving them and I refused to cook some up for him. So we ended up here.   I'm so glad we did. I went a head and ordered a chili cheese dog and fries. I love chili. I was pleasantly surprised about how good the whole dog was! I ate it all. The fries are seasoned and tasted great too.   They had the football game on when we entered. Another bonus!
