rc3dj0wKuI75EO69UOJEAQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while now and when my hubby and my mom wanted lunch one day I knew they'd dig this place.   First of be prepared to wait or call it in first. Since I checked their menu out via Yelp prior I knew exactly what we wanted to order. I ordered the # 4 which is the Vienna Chicago Dog and a 3inch Beef Sandwich which I had them dip in the au jus. Joel ordered the #10 which was a full sized Beef Sandwich dipped with sweet peppers and cheese. I brought mine home to share with my mom and Joel took his back to work. By the time I got home I had a phone call from Joel saying how epically awesome the sandwich was! The taste was truly like Chicago! The hot dog yum! The snap of the meat and the sport peppers added the perfect spice. The meat on the sandwich was thin and tender. Mmmmm we've been talking about it ever since.   Other then the long wait you can't go wrong with Windy City. I can't wait to go back to try the pizza and another sandwich. Great flavor  and huge portions are assured you in every bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yweitR7ugX72UPRaACVYmg.text: I found my new favorite pizza place in Vegas!  I'm a self proclaimed pizza snob and much to the ire of friends and family am usually not overly impressed with most others call great pizza.  That all changed this afternoon.  I'm not a fan of thin crust so a good deep dish is the way to my heart.  I've had Chicago pizza in Chicago and it's always been meh.  I came in for a single slice of the sausage deep dish but was informed that they were all sold out for the day.  They usually stop serving single slices around 4pm but in my case they sold out early (it was 3pm).  Decided to order a 12 inch sausage supreme to go.  It takes 30 min to bake but it's well worth it.  The crust was perfectly baked, light and flavorful.  The pizza was several inches deep and was loaded with onions, green peppers, mushroom, and of course big chunks of Italian sausage.  The sauce is rich and slightly sweet and has chunks of tomatoes in it.  Windy City has dine in or carryout options.  There is also outside seating.  They have an extensive menu of all foods Chicago.

Rh4WwDL4hGnH7pn3s8IUhg.text: Great food and friendly service. I always get the number 4 it's a Chicago dog and hot beef sandwich combo n comes with fries. Can't beat it for $8.50. I get both loaded and the sandwich wet. Amazing. Happy I live so close to this place.

rV1If6xz2WYVzZ0kS_8ldQ.text: My only complaint is how far we have to drive to get there.  But, trust me .... it's WORTH the drive!!  Hands down, this is the BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS!!   I first learned about this spot when I visited with a local foodie group.  It was SO worth it.  I have returned several times, and it is CONSISTENTLY GREAT.  I have had the pizza and the Italian Beef Sandwich.  The sandwich was really good, but the pizza is the star.  Their sauce is delicious, and the thin, crispy crust is excellent.   The service is WAY better than I had expected from a small pizza place.  They treat the customers the way one would expect in a fine dining establishment.  They have a nice, front patio area, complete with a giant fountain. I cannot say enough about WCB&P.  I will return every time I want a great pizza, or want to impress friends from out of town. I LOVE THIS PLACE!! -Joe

LcZBcZsq8OsFT-e8spERdQ.text: This is the best place for Chicago style pizza! Not only is it yummy, they have an awesome team who cares about service. It makes me miss home in the Midwest even more. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

my6hN4e4T7FLMIw7hSvEwg.text: I'm Italian born and raised in the heart of Chicago and since we moved to Las Vegas 8 years ago... Windy City is by far #1 on my list for authentic Chicago-Style pizza, beef and Vienna hot dogs!!! The atmosphere alone makes me quite homesick...

xFcEvP1SOhdpnBbMjTV0Wg.text: My dad is a native of Chi-town so he knows his pizzas. I've lived in Illinois for a few years as well so I'm acquainted with the Windy City's style (which kind of made me a bit picky about pizzas).   The place has a pretty spacious eating area decorated with Chicago sports memorabilia. They also offer free hot dogs if you have their name of the day. Too bad my middle name didn't count for today's name of the day.  Their dogs are great and there's lots of combinations available if you're in the mood for a slice of pizza or Italian beef. They even offer Green River at this place too.  We took a deep dish pizza with us home and  I was stuffed after one slice. Since my mom doesn't eat meat my dad and I are gonna have a hard time finishing this thing by ourselves!  Only advice I might add is that they only have 1 or 2 ladies (who are nice) taking orders so be patient the food is worth it. :)

fi2bq8q_4J3Xz5g5HfJU2A.text: I am from chicago and have had some great pizza.But windy city has some issues with their pizza.It lacks flavor, as is having no flavor at all. it is greasy and is overpriced as is most of the items on the menu.The staff are usually friendly.I will definitely go for a pizza puff and fry or beef sandwich cause my options are limited.If a Portillos opens up i would be worried for this place!!

lmIAiR4XfC-3HM0n6Jntyw.text: Long overdue for a review for this excellent establishment in Henderson, NV. We've been to several "Chicago styled" deep dish pizza (ddp) places in my days from Chicago to California. I have to say that outside of Chicago, probably the best deep dish pizza place we've been to. IMO the sauce and crust are what differentiates between a good and great ddp. Their pizza tasted little 'healthier' (less heavy and greasy) than other places, even most places in Chicago. The owners are also very friendly. Just a little advice, if you're planning to dine in: It takes a good 45 minutes to cook so order ahead and enjoy.

Called to place a delivery order and the older lady that answered the phone was extremely rude and rushed me.  Did not feel comfortable placing a order here.  Just had a feeling of carelessness. C61Re3lmXzMdqzbINdcOfg.text: Now THAT is how you make a hot dog!!! I had two Chicago Style dogs and they were incredible! Loved the Sport Peppers on top and they were cooked to perfection! I was nervous when I walked in and saw catsup on the table, but was quickly comforted by the nice girl working as she told me that was for the fries. _A9qH6fVjJPPEg9bJDtBAw.text: I've been meaning to do this for a long time. Coming from Chicago I'm very fussy about pizza. Windy City has THE BEST PIZZA ANYWHERE. I just don't mean Las Vegas or Chicago. Their crust and sauce are fantastic. They make the za amazing. But it doesn't matter if you get cheese or sausage it's coming out perfect. Sometimes I forgo pizza because their Italian Beef or sausage is great. Super hotdogs are on the extensive menu also. You can't go wrong.

iDG_BMiUaFHQrsEVBhiV9g.text: Been there many times. The food is tasty,  great deep dish pizza.  The Ruben sandwiches and hot beefs and hot dogs are really great too. Nice lunch place and the service is very friendly.  Fun place to go to watch the bears.

J8kumiZTm5oaDqlBA36fxQ.text: Yes this is a pizza joint, but I was sent to review the burger as I often do, so here you go:  This particular iteration is located on Eastern just south of the 215 in your average Vegas strip mall. It's tucked in the corner behind an outdoor seating area identified with some fairly small signage. If I wasn't specifically looking for it I probably never would have seen it. The interior is filled with your standard plain pizza restaurant furniture, and fully decorated with plenty of Windy City sports team memorabilia. The menu predictably includes plenty of options involving hot dogs, pizzas, sausages, as well as burgers, wings and fingers.  I went with the #6 Windy City's Burger & Fries: "a mouth watering 100% all beef patty with lettuce, onions, tomato & pickles. Special sauce served on sesame seed bun." My burger was brought to me in a red plastic basket; I've hated this choice over a plate in the past, but it turned out to be large enough to work ok this time. The bun was a bit too large for the patty that was within, but it was very flaky and fresh. The meat had almost a questionable light grey color to it, but was somewhat flavorful and cooked well. It was not quite one of those patties you'd order medium rare, but still ok. The pickles and LTO were all good; fresh and just enough of each. The special sauce was kind of salty, and I'm not sure what it was exactly. I wasn't too crazy about it, but luckily it was only present in some spots. This was a messy burger, very juicy and not dry. Overall it was decent but nothing to go out of your way for.  The fries were of the very generic frozen variety, but they were cooked so well that I still enjoyed and ate them all. They were presented in a brown paper bag; I'm not sure if this is a tradition in Chicago or something? The #6 is a very reasonable $5.95. I was charged $8.86 so I assume this included another $1.75 for the fountain drink I ordered, and is apparently not included in the meal combo pricing. For a typical strip mall pizza restaurant this was a decent burger, but I think it's the same that you would get from probably any pizza restaurant in town so I can't say its worth going out of your way for. Still, if your friends or family are demanding pizza and you feel like eating something else, it's not the worst burger in the world.

XsrgPZnPSzNvTOCekgcE7A.text: Found this place on Yelp. Pretty neat when you walk in and see all of the Chicago memorabilia. Friendly staff. Food is delicious!!! We had the thin crust and wings. Way better then Pizza Hut.

cOAwceKOG_HnJX5ojscaSg.text: Visiting from Cali, found this place while coming up the 215.   Had the WCBNP Specialty pizza, and its freaking delicious!  Deep dish pizza that's not super greasy.  The tomato sauce is light and tasty, and the crust makes it all work.  Well done!!

w8UCWHh4qt_UB4MG1Hs26g.text: I was NOT impressed.  Thank God we had a Groupon because if I would have paid full price I would have been livid. The salad was mediocre at best. The dressing looked like mayo and the pizza was all dough. I do not recommend this place at all.

But I absolutely love their Chicago Deep Dish pizza which they only serve at their Eastern Avenue location.   Everyone seems friendly. I like the atmosphere. There is several large screen televisions playing different sports. Tons of pictures and news articles about Chicago and their sports teams. Who didn't love the 85 Chicago Bears??  The bad news is their pizza is addictive. Every time I drive by another pizza place, I think about that Chicago Deep Dish pizza. Their pizza will fill you up with just a couple slices. 7nhtlWe-GmXAM3EYmOFPTg.text: Just came in for a slice of pizza. I was told they are out of pizza. What kind of pizza place doesn't have pizza? Why did I go out of my way to get some Chicago style pizza? They just stared at me blankly until I walked out. I have no idea what's going on there.

9xLl_miJ-iSJzHLcHBqIsw.text: Wow! Visited yesterday for the first time and i will definitely be back. Great prices on Beer/Wine ($2 beers when i visited.) Friendly staff that was attentive and speedy. Started off with a Chicago dog and it was authentic (down to the bun) and tasted wonderful. The Deep dish pizza was very good, cooked throughout, excellent amount of toppings. (I'm eating a piece as leftovers right now) The ONLY downside was their lack of metal utensils. Eating deep dish pizza with a plastic knife and fork is difficult for me. It  brought down the overall experience, although not enough to consider skipping out (I'd rather bring a knife and form from home, lol) Keep it up WCBNP, ill be back!

oplVbUCDLCa89ZohEVTUBA.text: Piazza is good and consistent. But would never eat from here again because of the manager. Her name was Nina

vVHy3l2_zv8d7CDIOJbfDg.text: Great pizza and wings! Surprisingly consistent on how often they forget essentials like buffalo sauce and ranch when you order delivery. What's the point of ordering wings when they are bare? This can be forgiven once, twice, maybe even three times but really? It happens way too often. Won't be ordering from here again.

au0WmPpgX3WqcQN8ON1NbQ.text: If you're an ex-Chicago guy like me, living in Los Angeles is like living in a Hot Dog desert.  It's not that I would eat hot dogs in Chicago often (not the healthiest of meals).  But when you have a taste for a RealDeal Chicago Dog and cannot quench it, that quench festers -- sometimes for years at a time.  So I was off-the-wall bonkers to discover this Highly-Rated Chicago HotDoggery in the middle of Las Vegas on my last trip there.  It's RealDeal and then some, bless them.  A soft, steamed poppy seed bun filled with the perfectly steamed Vienna Frank then topped with yellow mustard, neon-green pickle relish, chopped onions, a slice of kosher pickle, sliced tomatoes and Louisiana sport peppers, all bathed in a sprinkle of celery salt.  When done properly (as done in this establishment) it truly is a meal that would be fawned over in Paris.  It's that good!  Then to ice it, they serve Chicago-style hot tamales.  They're nothing like the authentic banana leaf tamales as served in L.A., but I guarantee you they taste infinitely better.  Next time you're rolling 7's or pulling that ace to grace your 21, take a break, hop into a taxi and treat yourself to the most fabulous hot dog -- it's gourmet! -- you've ever treated your tastebuds to.

LsoFWG--V8eCkqb9tMsMmw.text: The deep dish pizza is soooo good. I was only able to eat one slice but it was tasty. The pizza box alone was very heavy.   The cannoli was really good. The cream was rich and sweet.   This is a most try place.

TYZ1MMBwFOUmOqGel75zBA.text: As an ex Chicago citizen I crave my beef but they are hard to come by in SoCal. When I was in Vegas recently I searched for Chicago style food and found this place. I'm so glad I took the 10 mile trip. I had the Italian beef sandwich hot and dipped and it was one of the best beef sandwiches I ever had and I've eaten a ton of them in my lifetime. The place looks like most any other beef and dog place in Chicago. The sandwich was huge. Ordered the beef, fry and drink special and I think it was about $11.00. Worth every penny. Can't wait for my next Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E6k9BDYNGYDyrjiYMp4LGA.text: OK, I'll start with a tip. If you are a Dodger fan, don't show up at Windy City Pizza during a Cubs playoff game and expect to feel welcome. The place was packed with avid Cubs fans and about 5 TVs playing the game. The good news for me - the Cubs were in the process of beating the Giants, so I had no conflict. I shared a small deep dish pizza with my wife. Unequivocally, the best pizza I have had in Vegas. High quality cheese and delish crust. Two slices and I was stuffed. We got to bring home half the pie for dinner the next night (yes, it re-heats really well). If you are fan of Chicago style deep dish pizza (or you are a fan of the Chicago Cubs!) and are looking for an inexpensive, informal meal, this is the place to go.

0PKj3uZyC5l7oUhHV1eETA.text: When walking in you place your order at a counter before sitting down & fill your own pop/tea at a fountain machine. The woman who took our order was polite & went above  and beyond in service. We ordered Italian beef, a Chicago dog combo with a small beef, & a half baked pizza to go. We had to sit outside because our dog was with.  The patio area is covered & shared by the other businesses around. Shortly after sitting down the woman who took our order brought everything out to us and even gave us a free hot dog cut into little pieces for our dog. Very nice!  The beef and hot dog were great. Just like in Chicago. The thin pizza we got to finish cooking later didn't appear to be half baked but it still heated up fine without burning. Neither my husband or I liked the pizza very much. The crust was nice and thin ( which is hard to come by in Vegas) but it was very greasy and the sauce wasn't very good. I wouldn't get it again. Might go back and try a deep dish slice to see if it's any better.

F8b9AQgy3m5P_Q8PmnWWrg.text: I love this place. Being from Chicago, it hits home with all the decor (newspaper articles, photos, posters, memorabilia for every Chicago sports team) and to top it off, the food is FANTASTIC and reasonably priced! They even keep Jays chips in stock! I recently brought my boyfriend here to give him a taste of my hometown, we both got the #4, we were full for the whole day and only spent $10 each. Everyone is so nice here, the owner has been in every single time I've come, you can tell that they care about their business and their customers. Stop in for a hot dog, Italian beef or deep dish pizza, grab a beer and watch the game. This place is the spot for homesick Chicagoans or anyone who wants great food and a great atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath

xdPOwxSV_EgLwyrzi5UP1Q.text: All I can say is that when I ordered the wings, I was thinking that the chicken that they malnourished.  And, I thought they were also overcooked.  Next, I thought the price was very expensive for 12 pieces of undersized overcooked wings.  Once I got them on the plate, I can tell you that the wings were some of the most tender, simply flavored and delicate wings i have had. i really enjoyed them.  The waitress also said that on Saturdays, they do wings and a pizza for a special price and on Tuesday's it is .50 per piece.  I am coming back for sure.  The sauces for the wings are mild to hot and while I really like hot sauce, the wings were so tasty, I had them mostly plain.  We came here really for the Chicago pizza.  We had the loaded pizza on a thin crust.  The pizza was cut is squares and i am told that is how it is always done in Chicago.  The pizza was great and the vegetables in this loaded pizza were some of the best, crunchy instead of soggy!  I am coming back here for the deep dish!  Besides this, they have a variety of sausages and hot dogs. I haven't tried them yet, but it sounds really good.  The only problem is that for me, it is all about wings, then pizza and hot dogs / links / sausages are the   Like I said, I will be back for the deep dish and then on a Tuesday, so I can have more wings.  GK says check it out!

r9kjgi0NqLeuEewif9jSqA.text: Everything has been good,,,but today I ordered the Gravy Bread .....it's a side,,,but enough for 2 people REALLY brought me back to my Portillo's days,., Thank You Windy City !

mYPw7gRYcqUxuvjuzI1KiQ.text: Love the pizza puff and Chicago dogs. Coming from Chicago this is the best representation.

Lb6Vcik1pKEJ3ezNES6esg.text: This place has great food. Let me say that again, this place has great food. The problem with this place is the staff. I don't know if it's some kind of "Chicago thing" (which is completely BS, I've been to Chicago many times and nobody acts like this) but the lady working the counter couldn't have been more annoyed with everything we did. We asked to put tables together because we had a big group...eye roll. I changed my mind about the pizza topping before she ran the order in...eye roll and attitude. I didn't decide what beer I wanted within 4 seconds...more attitude. I could keep going. Maybe she was having a bad day or maybe it's this kind of made up Chicago attitude that she perceives as charming, but it's tired and dumb and I don't get why anyone wants to eat somewhere while "Flo" tells you to kiss her grits. I'll take my business somewhere else. If you're willing to deal with service like this then your a better person with me.

mKIMfbMP1_MwRJYy-N15KQ.text: Relaxed atmosphere. Found this place after searching on the Internet where to watch the Blackhawks games in Vegas. Although thru the first 10 games or so we have been there about 5 games.. There hasnt been many hockey fans which is good and bad.. Not quite a loud hockey atmosphere but at the same time its chill and plenty of room to see the big screen and 4 other tvs. The owner is cool we spoke to him for awhile while his brother was in the restaraunt. Very nice gentlemen and hawks fans from Illinois! I duno the workers name but she works alot an is really nice . Also they have random free hot dog giveaways  .. They put two random names onthe board and if its yer name u get a free hot dog! One of these hawks games days  hopefully itll say " Greg and Holly"

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wjmemdi-WGOdE6-VC29s3Q.text: Best Chilli dog ever, and yes I had them put extra extra Onions. It was delicious.  Foot long hot dog with chilli & Onions , came with a side of fries. Good atmosphere.  Big screen with other flat screens mounted around dinning room.  I been here before but not on weekends. Just wanted a snack while out running errands- Wanted a slice of pizza , but you can only get sliced on week days, Chilli dog made up for everything. This a Chicago hang out, but Cowboys always welcomed......

9fgzULJ0ACtfaO6aSuaW4w.text: Windy City Beefs n Pizza has the best Chicago food and I love eating there. Their Chicago hot dogs are the best! Great atmosphere, great food and great prices.

XNGm3vL_cBBs1IkJGsfsbQ.text: Perfect place for pizza or lunch even dinner. Very affordable. And absolutely delicious. One of my favorite places in Henderson to eat! If u are looking for good variety of food with great taste and great price, try this place!! They will greet u with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front door

xd0-2Sxj9SJxFDbsqbj4mQ.text: I have come here a a couple of times due to their groupon that they consistently have up. I normally get their thin crusts and I have gotten their deep dish on one occasion.   I have gotten multiple thin crusts here,  and they have always been good. I normally settle with a cheese and a sausage and pepperoni. I wish the cheese had more cheese, but it is still tastey. You can actually taste the sauce, which has good flavor, and the meats that they use have a nice flavor and don't make the pizza greasy like other places.  I tried their cannoli, which was tastey for a Chicago pizza joint. Their regular salad tasted like it was out of a salad bag kit, nothing special, but not necessarily bad either.   My only gripe is their deep dish. It is more like a Pizza Hut pan pizza, which isn't what you would want when you are expecting Chicago style deep dish. I don't plan on getting it again when I return. Other places in town like Amore Taste of Chicago makes a way better pizza with a legit deep dish crust.  Overall, a decent place to get pizza. I'll continue to buy their groupon for their thin crust, and possibly buy their other menu items, like their sandwiches, sausages, and hot dogs, when I see something that catches my eye.

2GWYtZtiBiAnmnYkUq-g6A.text: The 2 stars are for the Italian beef sandwich. Now to be fair I am comparing this to Portillo's in Chicago. So compared to there Italian beef, Windy city had very little flavor to the beef and I also had it wet which also brought very little flavor to the Sandwich. We also got the loaded Chicago style pizza to take with us which I give 4 stars, Would have been 5 but there was sliced carrots in it. They didn't cook soft so there was a crunchy piece of carrot in every other bite. Had to be a mistake, who puts carrots in a pizza pie. I would go back for the pizza without carrots, but not the beef sandwhich.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded deep dish with Carrots (WTF)
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian beef with peppers

yhIO4xSA7K0-J2Hp1xfmCA.text: Ordered a deep dish pizza for pickup tonight. We loved it so much that we will try to get there at least once a month because we live way over near Summerlin. I'm really hoping they will open one on our side or somewhat closer. We are native Chicagoans and already frequent the Windy City Beef and Hot Dogs on Lake Mead. We really need the pizza now!!!!

by9DVpyDnKWqzWVG_skyQg.text: We came here to redeem a Groupon and noticed a 20 dollar large pizza any choice and wings special going on.  They still offer the free hot dogs for name of the day.  Today it was Vito.  Heyyy Vito!  All of the food was decent - I enjoyed Rosati's more but then again Windy is a lot more affordable and if you live on this side of town I could understand the appeal.  IMO there's better Chicago style options so I won't be going out of my way but it was pretty good.  Def check it out if you live on this side of town.

wRfx04QpcQxFwQCxsPCVeg.text: Good Chicago Food !! Good Chicago service!!! Enjoy it every time we go!! Love the gyro, hotdogs and beef sandwich!! Can see a good Chicago game too !!

X0DI2aKRvJ3f6xQNL9luNw.text: Had the gyro and fries. Delicious, reminded me of Chicago diners I used to visit. Can't wait to go back and try other items.

v2DIRZ8YwyXk6duhJPX5Vw.text: Maybe I should have gotten what there famous for.  I got a hamburger....Yea, at a pizza place!  WHAT WAS I THINKING! I was thinking, they might have pizza by the slice!   They didn't so, I had to go for something else.  I really didn't want to spend $11.00 on a cheese pizza!  It was only for me, so all I wanted was a slice....Boo hoo hoo!  Ohhh well, maybe one day, they might cross my mind, and I will want to try a Chicago style pizza, but I'm not going to break my neck to run back over there!

XUjqTNVcNUiltzYkKpYI3g.text: As a Chicagoan, I'm critical of my food that has a Chicago stamp on it. I came here the first time as a homesick new resident of Vegas and had the most comforting, welcoming, and home-like experience possible. Chicago memorabilia all over the walls, a place for me to mark where in Chicago I'm from, and the friendly faces of former Chicagoans dying to talk about their memories of home.  The food is dead on!! I've gotten thin crust pizza and dipped beefs here and I could have cried it was all so right. Coke products to accompany the food as well as books of old hot-spots. If I could, I'd eat here all the time for a little piece of home again. Thank you guys for making my experience so great!

LeArJaUSRKprw-lgS52D7A.text: Oh my yes... Amazing. No comparison. This place is affiliated with the one up north (5 stars as well). Amazing  Italian beer, sausage, pizza, Chicago staples, etc. if you're from Chicago, you need to stop in. They have a big screen tv that shows all the Chicago games when they're on. Ample seating and seating outside as well.

LLDs7v1_eOp5WJvzBg3kXg.text: The Italian Beefs here are a True representation of Chicago Beefs. I'm so glad I've found this place, it reminds me of home. The cashier at the front counter was extremely friendly and we hit it off because she knew about my home town. It felt good walking into a piece of Chicago in the middle of the valley.  I will definitely go back although the one cook thought I was too chatty and wanted me to "go home already" his own words, don't know if he knew I heard him but whatever homes .... I felt like I was at home. So...with that being said I'll see you next time with my chat box .

rVlk0EHcodq-vO47DJyD8Q.text: Feeling homesick for Chicago? Come here.  Hawks, Bears, Bulls, Sox, and Cubs banners and pictures decorate the walls and they have Vienna Beef hotdogs made Chicago style.  The pizza is the best I've had in the area and the staff are so friendly.  They also have different specials everyday which are always fantastic deals.  I love coming here and it's probably my favorite restaurant in the area.

vwmGYTkK87Mmbj7xAKYRNw.text: This is a great place.  Low on pretense, high on delicious.  The atmosphere is basic and functional with lots of Chicago-bilia on the walls and if its baseball season, a Cubs game on the TV.  But the food is where this place shines.  The deep dish is every bit as good as in Chicago, and the dogs are authentic (although there is ketchup on the table!).  Even the salad is an authentic midwestern dish; iceberg lettuce and some onion, what the heck else do ya want?!  Allow 25 minutes for the pizza to cook, it is worth the wait.

0bfGXUWicItofbzBGvCP9A.text: Deep dish loaded was fantastic. 12 inch was very filling and tasty. Highly recommend.

HCATURAzZzXDgxPy4oQmyA.text: Love love love the food and service here!  I always get the #5 spicy sausage with everything, food is made to order and fries are always hot & fresh. I haven't tried the pizza yet and always say "next time" but I love hot dogs and just can't resist =) Great prices too!

-f79sV_GehFhZ96fo38Xtw.text: I love going to Windy City, especially on a Bear's game! Every time I order something different and every time I enjoy it. I wasn't that hungry tonight, so I just got a corn dog, a 312 Chicago beer, and fries. It was delicious.  Also, you won't find a better atmosphere anywhere else.  I'm coming back for Bull's games.

umw--BWXafdCuoH1G9sbqg.text: Windy City Beef N' Pizza is a lot of fun. The food is decent. I've never been to Chi-town, but it seems to represent it well. If I'm in the mood for a hot dog or slice of deep dish pizza I know where to go.

jjE82XJLBp7spVppk2VfRw.text: First of all I bought a Groupon before I even try this place out but the False advertising pizza picture of a real Chicago pizza got me. Got the one for $19 that was my first mistake I made thinking this place knew what a Chicago pizza even was. Well I was right putting sauce on top of a pan crust pizza is not a Chicago pizza look at your fake picture that a real pizza.  I guess they have never even been to Chicago or tried a real Chicago pizza before. I ate 2 slices could not even find or taste the topping on it had to put ranch and Sriracha just to get it down. The cheese was questionable not even sure if it was real cheese no stringiness to it. The pizza just taste like grease with a can of tomato sauce on top. The other 6 slices in about the only thing Chicago like was the pizza box are in my garage in the trash can and that is the first time I ever threw a pizza away in my life. The salads that came with it was a joke only iceberg lettuce and 2 not ripe thin slices of tomatoes and some expired onions plus the garlic mayo they call a dressing (disgusting) that normally they charge $4 for lol food cost is about $ .55 cents per salad. I understand markup but give me a break this place is a ripe off. As far as the 2 cannolis that came with it was store bought after one bite they went in the trash also. So that was a waste of $ 19 plus the $ 1.88 tax it would have been better spent at Walmart on frozen pizza , head of lettuce , tomato and a onion. Then I could have bought a real desert and still had dollars left over. The inside of the place is not even worth mentioning or the employees either because you should never have to go inside this dump. Just buy a frozen pizza you will enjoy it more and save money too.

sTOOj2TvGtDhg5GSIVvShA.text: Stopped in here for the first time today. I'm a lover of hot dogs, sausages and pizza so I decided to give it a try. There was a woman working. Instead of looking at the entire menu which is pretty big I told her I wanted 2 hot dogs with onion and jalapeno. She said they didn't have jalapeno so I asked her what kind of toppings were available. She was very annoyed for some reason and was like relish, onion, etc etc,  and said THATS WHAT A CHICAGO DOG IS. OK I'm not from Chicago, I've never had a Chicago dog and that's not what i was asking. I also ordered 2 of the spicy sausages and again she gave me a condescending response and said polish or italian?? I work in service industry,  I completely understand that it can be annoying when people ask questions or seem stupid but this was not the case. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Anyhow the food was mediocre and with her horrible attitude I will not be back and I will surely tell others of my experience there

ZEDtJ2V2gFEKUf7WsfMNWQ.text: The only thing as good as the food, are the people.  Friendliest staff I've ever met, and food that will make your knees weak.  Have the beef sandwich "wet."  My knees get weak just thinking about it.

xqInukD4MEnIHcYCR6Y4zA.text: I tried this place based on the reviews. I got the Chicago deep dish. Horrible. TNot enough cheese, bad crust, horrible sauce, not enough sauce. I mean crappy, Pizza Hut would be better than this. Definitely not a good Chicago deep dish pizza. Still haven't found a good one in Vegas or henderson. Best I have had was Masa in echo park in SoCal.

yjcy9wrymv-dLN4ObfYLXA.text: Oh my!  We had the thin crust and wings. Wings were crispy but not overcooked, with sauce on the side. Pizza was cut in squares and excellent!  Needed just a little salt, but that's just me.  He didn't use salt at all. Atmosphere could use a little help. Don't know if this is just how they do it in Chicago or it was just bad.  Bright and loud with too many tvs. Food was good enough to go back for tho. Good place for kids and sports fans. Loved it.

wxi-zBKqp3KNOY3n_NVnsw.text: Ordered 2 # 2's 2 hot dogs with mustard,onion,green relish,pickle spear,tomatoes,peppers but told them one 1 order all I wanted on dog was mustard, relish and sauerkraut and they had nerve to charge me extra for the sauerkraut. WTF, got less, charged more.  Then they screwed up order and my well done fries were soggy when I got home due to waiting for them to fix order. BTW, dogs had no taste. Will stick to their pizza which is delicious

9hnXttCT_YzkluJrVpnTSA.text: Hot Dog was not bad and is about as close to a Chicago dog that you can get here in Vegas.  The Fries are the wrong type to be sold as Chicago Style. The rest......eh. The beef is a pre-cooked product as told by the person behind the counter. The great beef stands in Chicago roast their own beef and use seasonings that may vary from place to place , but have a much better flavor than what I found here. The bread which is an big part of the Beef Sandwich is a thick crusted bread that soaks up the juices without getting doughy. Not the case here. The pizza........ forgetaboutit. It is not at all real Chicago style. I grew up in a family that owned a top Pizza-aria that was well known in the area. We were in business over 60 years. My Great Grandfather was one of the first to bring Beefs and Pizza to Chicago. If you want authentic, this is not it.  If you have come to like mediocre food called Chicago Style then this is what you get.

A8lFq3dR2N45ojpPEWehTw.text: Just discover these guys, great deep dish pizza, True Chicago style. Only thing that could have done to get 5 stars would be to have more toppings on the pizza.

gWhAyXDe93q-kOwihmwQug.text: Ordered two italian beef dipped sandwiches. They were the best I ever had. The lady taking orders was so friendly and attentive. Service was quick and helpful. The place was clean and organized. Would highly recommend.

dlUQYT6dInSbB3w10iMcmA.text: Bought the groupon to give this joint a try.  The food was fresh and yummy.  The groupon was for 2 salads, a 14" deep dish and 2 cannolis.  The salads were non-descript except way too much onion.  The pie though...holy moly was it good! You can taste the freshness in their food!  I wish I had read the menu before because I would have had them put giardenera (spelling) on it!  A little messy, you have to use utinsels to eat but what self-respecting chicago deep dish is eaten with a fork?!?  Only had 1 slice each and we were stuffed!  I will be having again for dinner the next night :-)  The cannolli was delish!  Ate mine and told my husband he probably wouldn't like it so he should give me his.  It didn't work!  We will definitely be going back and made sure to grab a menu so I could call ahead and pick up after work!  Would recommend at the drop of the hat.  Thank goodness for groupon because I might have missed this joint.

gGlaunJNOFcLD4Z5klon9g.text: Just had Windy City beefs N pizza and all I can say it was excellent! I had the #10 which is the Italian beef. You get enough beef on the sandwich to fill up 2 sandwiches. I also had the chili cheese fries, perfect portion and great flavor all for $10! I will definitely be going back there soon!

j8BD0rw35aF4ecSKBgoHDw.text: Great deep dish pizza.  I've only been there once so far, but the deep dish pizza was so good! For dessert we had chocolate covered cheesecake on a stick! Love this place. Can't wait to come back and try the other items on their menu.

XAtRbe8BE7tCdpmGavZ1Iw.text: First time eating here. Delicious deep dish pizza and cannolis!! Friendly service. Will definitely come back!

T95yHBeFeL2IYRutgLnlGQ.text: Simply fantastic. With this place close to my new home, it helps with the home sickness. Awesome food. Awesome staff. Awesome Decor. Overall great atmosphere. A fun place to get lunch and watch a little bit of a Cubs game.

-ZQRDojEkzrTWVhE4gRlZg.text: Had a gyro, and is one of the best ones I've ever had. I'm from Chicago so I'm critical when it comes to gyros, beefs, pizza and hot dogs. Still have to try the other foods here though.

_A7dqdT1WzoZU_LPh8Opvg.text: Finally found a place in Las Vegas for Chicago style hot dogs and Italian beef sandwiches, just sorry I live across town.  I love the comb beef and sausage sub too.

95Hjrey1CTd7yMlMcjINbg.text: Awful customer service. We just went to pick up our order and when we asked for the special on the sign they would not honor it. Tacky decor. Don't waste your time or money here. Food is average at best.

poIhBflCP0K9aA7zwSChDQ.text: I can't say enough about how much I like this place. The food is always great, without fail. The staff is so nice and treats you like family. Whenever I go out for lunch, I think about going here. Hot dogs, deep dish pizza, or my personal favorite, Italian beef sandwiches. I would recommend Windy City to anyone.

_3JcT_vDPF5DmFnJ51hvqg.text: I have to admit before coming here I was not a deep dish fan. But after eating here my point of view has changed. Ok I'm done writing a review because its time for a afternoon nap. (In a good way.) Thanks WCBNP.

HHAxBBxzuIe7ncwuYUxBkg.text: From Chicago- pizza was amazing and authentic. Owner and staff are incredibly friendly. Definitely recommend this place!

6rmhA_GPTbUa2-lkK2LUlg.text: The Italian beef was good but the pizza wasn't a deep dish. It was more like a pan pizza you can get at pizza hut. So if your looking to get a chicago style deep dish you will be a little disappointed.

81MEIo5jCzXUCMeo-fQBGA.text: Kept it simple and went with a standard hotdog, fries, and half an Italian beef sandwich (the #4). Hotdog, got it right: steamed poppy seed bun, Vienna dog with right amount of snap to it, all the usual Chicago dog trimmings. Fries, hot and crispy, appear to be hand-cut, and if not, using a quality frozen. The Italian beef, meh: believe they are using the frozen Vienna product most places outside of Chicago use.  Overall, getting the job done. If you want an Italian beef, find a place that actually makes their own, like the beef places back in Chicago do.

YZzho_x_-dXmXny476CNyQ.text: Really good pizza, lot of sauce and lots of cheese. Just the way I like my deep dish. There thin crust was not nearly as good. I have not tried the dogs yet, but I will get to them. They are a little pricey for a pizza place but nit over the top.

UJwJShFatWUoKKiH2tXQvw.text: There are many Pizza places around the Las Vegas Valley.  This is the place for great deep dish pizza's and phenomenal Chicago dogs. They have a large seating area and a great staff.  Windy City Beefs n Pizza is my favorite place to eat.

4DeMznwEj2mMYtM3jOmMAg.text: The #4 Chicago dog and small beef really hits the spot. The giardeneria is a home blend that makes your taste buds awake with excitement. Being from Chicago I highly recommend this place to satisfy your craving for a taste of home. If you're not from Chicago I recommend this place to see exactly what you've been missing your whole life.

59xsPeBC4R3dFPqW0ArRzg.text: Sorry, I desperately wanted to find a great Chicago pizza place in Vegas, and I was told that this was better than Lou Malnatis and Giordano's, but it's simply just not True. Still searching!

vZujAfWpXRXGor0G-J3-0g.text: This place is really good. I have been coming here since right after they opened.  Their food is always good and fresh. The employees are super friendly as well and they make people feel like family. Tina is a doll. EAT HERE and you will not be disappointed, especially if you are from Chicago, it will satisfy your craving!

wxhmbc4OQEMkRg2_aV_HnQ.text: There "used" to be another "Chicago Hot Dog" place in this location.  HOWEVER, this new restaurant has the best beef sandwich I've had in years!  I used to think of Portillos (Chicago) as my favorite, but this new place knocks it out of the park.  The pizza "looked" delicious but I didn't order it because the beef sandwich is so big I barely finished it.  This place is really worth the moderate price for such a great meal.  I am so happy it's so close to where I live.  I heard they had another place north of the 215 for the other hungry people in the valley.    It is DELICIOUS.

cPuq2o0No1snaQUq7SGkEw.text: I love this place. After moving from Chicago to Vegas about 8 years ago my family had been looking for a good Chicago eatery and we found it here.   It's sorta a whole in the wall but is actually a lot bigger then it looks. Lots of seating, never had a problem with seating even with 7 or 8 people. Lots of really awesome Chicago stuff on the walls.....except all the stupid Cubs stuff.   The menu is really good. Good size, easy to understand, and has lots of choices. I really like the Italian beef sandwich. Wet. With cheese. The roll they use is really good and doesn't fall apart till the last bite. The meat is always on point and they give you a lot. The fries that come with it, they have more to be desired. They are okay but could be better. I've also had the original Chicago Dog! It's really good, sesame seed bun, green relish, pickle spear, tomatoes. The whole package. I really really really really really like that they have Green River soda and Jays brand chips. The prices aren't bad but could be a little bit cheaper. Staff is always nice and friendly. The one weird thing is sometimes they have these specials where if your name is Tom for example they give you a free hot dog. Or if you have a birthday that month they will give you a free drink. Haha I've never had it happen to me but it sounds good!   If you are from Chicago or like Chicago food and are looking for something authentic I'd definitely suggest this place!

YIw_-uoX-dCKhMAn7sm8LA.text: I must start by saying, WINDY CITY BEEFS N PIZZA HAS AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE.  While I was standing in line to place my order, I was watching the employees interact with the customers.  The employees were calling each customer by there name, which say a lot about this establishment.  The customers come here enough to build rapport with the employees.  It was our first time here and when we approached the counter the lady was very helpful, patient, and made good suggestions.  They bring your food to your table and they checked on us to see if we needed anything.  Food was really good and served in large portions.  The have a good selection on the menu.  I will be back to try so many other things that caught my eye!!!

hECpzwUwK4MYXJYI5lFTVA.text: Great pizza lots of toppings!  But I prefer thin crust New York style.  Sandwiches are skimpy on the roast beef meat, and pretty bland and flavorless.  Customer service average at best.

NMyqtSn70i4FUizvM1aC_w.text: Do not come to this place.!!! It's cheap for a reason. Thank goodness for the Cannoli which is worth the 2 stars

JLa8WdtXNtsWkGoR9w9SbA.text: I went to Windy City Beefs N Pizza in December 2014 for dinner with a friend on our way back to Los Angeles.  We took two deep dish pizzas, and the food was pretty good, but unfortunately not as good as a real Chicago deep dish pizza which is what I was hoping to get here.  The restaurant was almost empty when we arrived (It was about 12pm) so there was absolutely no wait to be seated. The service was decently fast and nice. The restaurant is in a strip mall and has a very large parking lot where it is very easy to find a spot. The atmosphere inside the restaurant was pretty nice and very "Chicago" with a lot of baseball and city references.  The price is also quite reasonable for what you get.  Overall, my experience with Windy City Beefs N Pizza was quite positive and I would recommend it if you're looking for a pretty cheap pizza on your way back to Los Angeles from the strip. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

0S-YEiZ0VB2D1ztVgZl68Q.text: I am no deep dish pizza connoisseur, but I know when it tastes good, and this place has some tasty deep dish pizza. We've come twice with Groupons and it is such a steal!! The salads are a miss with generic iceberg, tomatoes, and little else I remember with a choice of garlic or ranch dressing. It is more like ranch with a side of lettuce than vice versa since it is too thick to drizzle. Moving on, the pizza is the star of the show!! We ordered the deep dish with pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, and onion and boy do they pile it on! Every bite has plenty of toppings and a very crispy crust on the bottom. I don't even know how this is possible when so many NY style pizza places can't even manage to keep their crusts crispy with minimal toppings. I think this pizza may be the 8th world wonder.   The cheese used is amazing. It stretches and stretches. I bet it could reach the length of the table. Last time we were here on a Tuesday, and they had 50 cent wings. The wings here are always plain and come with various sauces to dip. They are legitimate, crispy, fried to perfection wings. After our order of 8, I really contemplated getting another batch because they were great, but had to remind myself that we still had that beast of a pizza coming. Lastly, we finished off with some cannolis. Even though it looks like they're already prepared and sitting in a fridge, the shells remain crispy. This place should be called No Sog Pizzeria, because nothing here is soggy. Eveything is crispy and perfect, just the way it should be!

8TBxsvBz3ZMxs4_3CzPaxg.text: This place is home away from "Sweet Home Chicago". Seriously, if you didn't go outside and feel the desert heat you would think you were in a typical Chicago style fast food joint.  I've had most everything here except the pizza and I can tell you it's all the real deal. Hot dogs, beef, Italian sausage, polish, and gyros. It's all just as good as you'd get back in Chi town.  My favorite meal here is the gyros sandwich and I'm a real stickler on this. There are several places to get gyros here in the valley, but if you want the real deal Chicago style gyros this place has it and does it right. They use real shaved off the spit gyro meat on a lightly grilled pita with onions, tomato, and tzatziki sauce- and that's it! No lettuce, olives, feta cheese, weird herbs, or funky dressings like some other places serve it. At last I've found a decent gyro in Vegas!  Also, nice people working there. Good service, Chicago sports on the TVs, and plenty of pictures and memorabilia on the walls to make you homesick.  I only wish they were closer to my house.

JdhUoPBqa0_YwftCe1vV-Q.text: 32 years growing up in Chicago.  this place is heaven for me. the hot dogs, beef,  and deep dish pie are beyond fabulous

3PCavwoWkbOWvAmKiW0FiA.text: FINALLY made time to trek all the way across town to give Freddy's/Nielsen's/Windy a run for *my* money LOL! I've been hearing a lot about their Deep Dish here...so that's what I ordered! Chicago Deep Dish : Half Pepperoni / Half Italian Sausage : yelp.com/biz_photos/wind... The crust here is great, buttery, crispy outsides, slightly chewy insides, with a great hearty tomato sauce and tons and tons of cheese hiding inside! This tasted much better than the "other" place on Durango that was highly recommended to me....so good! But it wasn't all perfect. The toppings tasted a bit cheap...possibly frozen or store bought? For all the love I tasted in the crust/sauce/cheese, I expected more. The pepperoni looked like they came out of a lunchables box, and didn't have much seasoning or flavor and no crispy consistency...soft and chewy. Sausage was ok, but I have been jaded with other pizza places in town, with home-made house sausage that has a bunch more flavor and spice...this one was hiding in the sauce and didn't make a statement. But everything else was great, even reheated for leftovers...the True test for great pizza! I ate pizza for the next two days because the pie was too much! A bit spendy...I think I spent around $18 for this 12in deep dish. I don't mind spending good money for great food, so it wasn't a bother...just expect it. I recommend checking it out! I just won't be making the 45min drive again anytime soon...or just have to find the right toppings to make a legendary za!

owJ_0-9YBYfy40YD7l_KSA.text: My girlfriend, best friend and myself literally stumbled upon this place by chance; we were walking around looking for another place and I finally got tired and said "How 'bout this?". I will admit that I am not a fan of deep-dish pizza, favoring the Neapolitan style crust we make at home. For once I didn't get my way, being out voted 2-1 in favor of the Chicago style house specialty.      I griped that the pizza was going to take 30 minutes. I whined to my girlfriend that I didn't like deep dish. I told my best friend that his favorite football team sucked and I suspected he was gay. I stewed in the smoldering resentment of my own girlfriend and best friend betraying my superior knowledge of what constitutes good pizza.   Then it arrived.    Thick, perfectly cooked, thin wisps of motz cheese clinging for life as each slice was pulled away. In short, it was the fucking bomb. Even if you are not a deep dish fan (like myself) I would highly encourage you to try a pie from Windy City; just learn from my experience and don't say shit until you taste it.

It was a pretty good deal. For the pizza, we got sausage and mushroom. It was very tasty and filling. I could only eat one slice! Customer service was ok. The older white lady was very short with me. I'm not to sure if it was because i had a groupon or not. Anyways, we'll be back to try other food here.

4Q5SOnyIRQ9TptZrdiWWvA.text: Ever since Chicago Tasty Dogs closed I thought I wouldn't find any place in Vegas close to me where I can get some quality Chi-Town eats whenever I felt homesick. I was very happy to find out that Windy City opened up in literally the same area. Once you walk inside you're met with a lot of Chicago-based memorabilia adorning the walls, so it really did make me feel at home. The staff are all really nice and are always a pleasure to see whenever I visit.  Here you will not only get Chicago style dogs (made with Vienna beef, nonetheless), but also other city staples like Maxwell St. Polish sausage, Italian beef sandwiches, Davenco gyros, and even Eli's cheesecake. As expected you can get deep dish pizza, but growing up it was all about Chicago style thin crust for me and they definitely do it right here: a crispy crust and cut in squares. And one thing I like to do here is, instead of just ordering the chili cheese fries, get a basket of fries with a cup of chili on the side to use for dipping.     I find it odd how many Chicago food establishments are suddenly popping up all around Vegas. However, this place continues to be my personal favorite. And you don't have to come from the Windy City itself to enjoy this place. I've taken several people here who're unfamiliar with Chicago food and I've heard nothing but compliments. It's just a simple quaint place with a friendly atmosphere and good food, and that's all that really matters!

Not even close to authentic Chicago style pizza.  Never had carrots on pizza by default. In fact, never had carrots on pizza until now. I'll opt for the frozen Home Run Inn pizza at Sprouts next time.  Atmosphere? Some interesting sports memorabilia on the walls; the tables and chairs are as cheap and uncomfortable as you can get.

0XM5VSv_ttqPtdF5hCu7Ng.text: As a Chicago-land native who moved to Vegas about 8 years ago, I'm incredibly picky about deep dish pizza and chicago dogs. So many places try to do these things and get them completely wrong, whether the pizza has too much dough on the bottom or soggy crust, or the hot dogs are missing an ingredient or prepare the hot dogs incorrectly, very few places do these Chicago staples justice.   However, Windy City actually does! While the water in vegas will cause some irregularities compared to the standard portillos or lou malnatis fare, Windy city is by far the absolute closest and best in Las Vegas for both Deep Dish pizza AND Chicago dogs.  The service is quick and pleasant, the owner is a really lovely guy, very nice and friendly, and the food is great. We even had them order all the Chicago-dog fixings for our wedding 2 years ago and they provided excellent service.  From proper crust to filling ratio on their deep dish, to the all important celery salt, sport peppers and lovely neon green relish for their chicago-dogs, they've got it all. Definitely stop by this place if you're homesick for some Chicago favorites.

cL_6omnXvQPOAPcY2u9oZQ.text: Windy City Beefs N Pizza is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to stop for a quick bite on the east side of town.  This hot dog and pizza feels like it was picked up in Chicago and dropped off in Henderson... every time I go I feel like I'm going to step out the front door and see Wrigley field.  Their food is authentic and packed with flavor but it won't break the bank (we had the spicy polish, chili cheese dog, and a plain hot dog with two drinks for around $30.00).  The staff are friendly and attentive, but not annoying while making sure somebody checks in with your table every 10-15 minutes (drinks are self serve so you never run dry).  Now, on to the food.  I ordered the spicy polish sausage with frys which was absolutely perfect.  Served in a steamed poppy seed bun, topped with grilled onions, spicy peppers, and what I believe was a chipotle mayo, this dog checks all the boxes.  The sausage is grilled to perfection with great caramelization.   Add in the snap of the peppers when you bite into it followed with the sweetness of the grilled onions and you're on your way to comfort food heaven.  The frys come out in a brown paper bag (which I think is a cool touch) and are sliced thin.  The frys are well salted and crispy, 10 out of 10.  All in all, Windy City Beefs N Pizza is an awesome place to go for a quick bite.  We'll definitely be back in the near future.  Tip: They don't serve slices of pizza on weekends.

yg5wTESQhr-wlltdpBDZdw.text: After visiting Chi-town a couple years ago, I was suprised to see a large number of take out joints and carryout's advertising an item known as an "italian beef". Upon further investigation by way of the Food Network and Google, I found out that this is the Chicago state dish along with the Chicago style pizza. While I never had the opportunity to try this item in Chicago, I was pleasantly surprised that a Chicago style eatery had opened near my house.  #13 Windy City Combo - A Chicago style Italian Beef and Sausage Sandwich Ordered this because I wanted to try an italian beef, but also wanted to try it with an Italian Sausage. Also wanted it "extra wet" to give it that authentic experience. The roast beef was extremely tender and flavorful with hints of garlic and spices. The italian sausage was flavorful with a little kick to it as well. And the roll was juicy due to the sandwich being dunked in a beef broth. All in all, it was a great sandwich.  I will be back to try the Chicago style Pizza, great experience here!

KHSYNtOcrQ9uGeamf36xlA.text: My love for pizza is no secret to anyone who talks to me for five seconds. Windy City Deep Dish is my current steady.  Five stars. really? Eff yes. The pie is perfect in my eyes. The sauce is the best pizza sauce I've had in months. Chunky, sweet, not spicy. Just perfect. The crust is crispy, yet soft in some spots and buttery. Other Deep Dish pies I've had have been entirely too doughy for my taste. Not this one. Also it's not too deep. I could eat this shit for every meal and I have....It's even good cold. My one tiny complaint about this is when you are dining in the restaurant they give you a plastic spork to eat with. I don't know if the owners have tried doing this, but it just doesn't work. Maybe they have flimzy sporks just to laugh at us. I ended up flicking the sauce all over my shirt which sucked since I was going to a party after. Yes, instead of pregaming on vodka at home (so 2010) I pregame with some deep dish pizza.  As far as the BEEF in Windy City Beefs N Pizza I can't and won't give my opinion just yet. I haven't tried it, but I am sure I will at some point. Chicago dogs are one of my favorite food groups so I will let you know whaz up when that happens.   Customer service is beyond great here. When I have dined in they check on you, but not to the point of annoying. Also, I ordered pizza to go and when I got it home I realized the crust was overdone. Seeing as though I paid $17 for a 12" za I called the restaurant to let them know. I spoke to Dakota who happens to be one of the owners and he apologized and said he would make me a new pizza and have it delivered right away. When getting up to get the order number I spilled the god damn Ranch dressing all over my pants, feet, couch and carpet like a champ. When my new za arrived 40 minutes later it was piping hot and had two Ranch dressings in the box. The owner delivered it himself and apologized again and collected the overdone pizza to show to the staff. Customer Satisfuckinfaction.  I don't know shit if it tastes like REAL Chicago pizza and frankly I feel bad for you folks who have to compare everything to that. What I do know is it tastes amazing to me. I've had to stop myself from going back there everyday since. Please give it a shot and share the carb guilt with me pa-lease.

G2XbBvKAPGvdif-sxLUCyA.text: I have been wanting to try this place ever since I saw the photos that fellow yelper Shirley B. posted of her meals here.  They have a location on Lake Mead & Buffalo that is much closer to my house but, I noticed an event submitted by another yelper Jaime W., that they were opening this newer location and having a grand opening special where the whole day everyone got 50% off the whole total dine-in bill! How could I not help support a local business and take advantage of such a great discount?!?! The place was packed! I was so glad that we were even able to get a table. The wait for our food was almost an hour but we knew upon walking in that it was a mad house inside and wanted to wait it out. Staff came by to talk to us regularly. It was nice to see all the support this place was getting. Since I knew we were getting 50% off the whole bill I figured this was a good way to sample several things and see what I liked and didn't. Here it goes!  The "Chicago Deep Dish Cheese Pizza" was by far the best part of the meal. The sauce is sweet and super tasty. The crust is thick and crisp on the bottom and chewy in the middle. I would always order this! The sad part is they told us that they only make pizza at this Eastern location. The Lake Mead location makes hot dogs and sandwiches. We would make the drive to this Eastern location just for the pizza!  Next was the "Windy City's Chicago Style Hot Dog". This is a spot on Chicago dog people! We are talking a Vienna all beef hot dog with a steamed (makes such a difference in how the dog comes together) Vienna poppy seed bun, mustard, onion, green relish, pickle, tomato, sport peppers and celery salt. The green relish is to die for! I recommend this for sure!  I wasn't impressed with the "Windy City's Chicago Style Italian Beef Sandwich". It had no flavor. If any of you have ever eaten at a "Portillo's" or "Al's Beef" in Chicago then you know what  good Italian beef is and this one here at WCBNP just doesn't cut it. I am willing to give this sandwich another try though since they were so busy maybe something was off and we did order multiple things. This sandwich was no reason not to give a 5 star review still because everything else was perfect.  We tried the "Windy City's Maxwell Polish" and I personally liked it. My man thought it was too charred on the outside but I like mine burnt! This one is a Vienna Polish sausage and you can get it plain or spicy, we chose spicy. They steam the sausage then grill it and serve it on a Vienna poppy seed muffin with mustard, grilled onions and sport peppers.   I wanted to try their fries so I ordered the "Full Basket Of Chili Cheese Fries". I had them add onions. This was so good, but chili had an off flavor. Chili with no beans wasn't the issue. The fries were great.   The place is clean and I noticed someone always wiping things down.  They serve beer and wine.  You can place an order for delivery! Call to find out if you are in the delivery area! They deliver up to 5 miles from WCBNP and charge $3.00 for delivery.  Check their website for monthly specials and coupons.  They do not accept personal checks or American Express. They do accept cash, visa, discover, and master card.  Outside is plenty of seating and in the middle of the seating is a peaceful sounding waterfall. So relaxing on a nice day I bet.  Lastly, go try this place!

LtsmFwzxDv92AcdvKtJd_A.text: I ordered a pop with my meal and didn't get questioned!  Sometimes you just want a hamburger with that Chicago flavor, pizza puff, or liquid cheese for your fries.  That kind of stuff isn't easy to find in Las Vegas.  Food is pretty good here.  Honestly a little bit pricier than what you would be used to back home in Chicago, but hey, we're in Vegas now... what do you expect!  Chicago hot dog that I've gotten on a couple of occasions is just OK.  I have yet to try the pizza, but looks pretty good.  The thing I like most about this place though is the feel.  The place made me miss home with all the Chicago memorabilia everywhere.  Love the big old Taylor sign that they have on the wall since I spent my college years at UIC living off Roosevelt and Taylor.  I'll be coming back just so I can try more of the menu.

qBCr4Qa2JgKRhnHNHVWgWg.text: Pricey but just ok. Person behind the counter was very nice.  Fries were served in a brown bag, cute!  Deep dish pizza was ok, nothing spectacular.  Huge tv though so if you want to catch a game, probably get there early enough to get a seat.

M2bJfok5zZtzLBypHS7WFg.text: I'll keep this short and sweet, because that's exactly what Tim the owner would want. Simple into the point. It's everything you want in Chicago style pizza and beef shop. Go here and get a deep dish pizza. Then go again, and get a dipped Italian beef. After that, you'll be hooked. It's like a little slice of Chicago in Vegas.

zZeE3hYS_-CVRstz8RzG4g.text: True definition of Chicago flavor! They are family owned and operated and never skimp on the serving. They also carry all the Vienna brand product for the absolute best all beef Chicago dogs! I had my usual Italian Beef (wet) with sweet peppers and Giardiniera the pic speaks for itself! Im in heaven! This meal is not for the faint at heart .......dieters beware lol

fIwZbp8w_b9JT0BYnUW_TQ.text: We pick up a Chicago style pizza. It was the BEST. The sauce is excellent. Pepperoni and sausage is my favorite.

pzLdcaEP8S_wukjpoRuK_w.text: Went on a Saturday, first thing I noticed was adequate spacing and size of the restaurant.   The girl at the counter was very cordial and definitely was on a mission to enhance the experience of eating there.   I had the winds and the Deep Dish sausage pizza.  The pizza was very good,loved the toppings and being a crust fan,I definitely enjoyed that part. lol  The wings were EXCELLENT,I know the pizza is the star but those wings are addictive. Perfect texture,taste. I plan to be there sometimes for the .50 cent wing Tuesdays. I am instantly a fan.   This place will do very well. I am confident.

20qqWkPMNOcUgT5ieKJJyQ.text: Lazy worker lady answering phone didn't want to deliver. Owner would be pissed at the service given. They said we are 14 miles away - but... We are 2.1 - ridiculous.

ppeceCgRPr_pjVnVtu-bEQ.text: There is so much to write about but if you go, remember to order the fries. Wow, is all I can say. They seem to follow the McDonald's method which is to boil the potato in salted water for a few minutes then fry them to a golden brown. Trust me, that salt bath makes all the difference in smell, taste, and texture vs regular cut and fried fries. But here I am going on about the fries when this is a pizza place...   There seemed to have been a large number of locals picking up lunch (always a good sign), and they do sell pizza by the slice. We ordered the Chicago Deep Dish and that baby was piled high with cheese and stewed tomatoes, the works. I have never been so full that they had to roll me out of the restaurant like Veruca Salt in Willy Wonka to have me "dejuiced." Super friendly staff that made me feel welcome, I will always visit when I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth the drive from any side of town!

sEOZ7EsCXOwpWf5U1Cjpwg.text: Had this place bookmarked for a while. Really wanted to try the italian beef. So, after a not so great visit to Taco y Taco, decided to come here for some more food. We ordered the sandwich and you can get it 3 ways....dry, with a ladle of au jus, or the whole sandwich dipped. We opted for the ladle. Also, you can add cheese and gardinere, which we did.  I guess I should have ordered dry with au jus on side, because I did not care for the amount of juice on it. It made the bread completely soggy and we ate in and had it fresh, and it was sooooo soggy. Like, borderline gross, but the flavor was pretty good. I wasn't impressed with the gardinere at all. I thought it would be tastier, or better and it was just eh. I doubt I'd come back to this location, as it's far from me, but I would like to have that sandwich again, and I believe the have a location near Summerlin.

J-uIjk6Ru8fOc7kmloI4pQ.text: I love this place. It definitely has the Chicago flavor. Anytime I feel like a taste of home I go here. If you call for pickup the service is fast and still hot! There is also patio seating.

0_YItB81jFASEiH92H253w.text: By far the best deep dish pizza in town. Even when u get delivery its piping hot and the cheese is stringy. Love this place

NGFu_o27ZjuP5OVRlHFpuw.text: Food is so good!! The service is now excellent! The last time I came here the lady that was up front was awful and rude. They have replaced her with someone new and she is so sweet! It's actually nice to be here and not have someone give you an attitude! Definitely the best Chicago joint around! Eat here!!

oFr3lBiVZYNUY7tGlI_qhg.text: This is the place to go when you're tired of Value Meals but need a value meal. You can score a Chicago dog and fries or a slice of Chicago style pizza and soda for $5. They change their specials monthly. Or score a free hot dog if your name happens to be one they randomly pick that day. Two names are picked and written on a chalkboard near the register.  Food is authentic Chicago, neon green relish and everything, and the restaurant has Chicago memorabilia all over the walls. Cool little casual place to eat a super affordable meal!

bo1oRcTfAeCl5dbpvwaOWw.text: I've eaten here twice, once with my wife and again with my son. As a Chicago native, I grew up with Portillo's, Johnnies Beef, Al's, and many other great Chicago Italian Beef and Hot Dog establishments; however, the King and reigning champ overall is still Portillo's, now owned by Berkshire Hathaway, where there are locations outside of Illinois and as far away as SoCal and the Phoenix area.  I've tried Windy City's Italian Beef and fries, and another time Italian Beef and Sausage combo. Good flavor to the beef, but the choice and quality of the bread just doesn't work for me. Portillo's and Johnnie's has the right bread that's just as good and the right texture whether wet/dipped or dry. The bread Windy City uses doesn't work at all if ordered dry, as it easily breaks away and falls apart, and when wet it's like mush. I'd highly recommend changing the bread to be like those offered by the establishments I've mentioned.  Also, when I was there with my lovely wife, when it was our time to place an order, the people taking our order where two women and both immediately had attitude and rolled their eyes when they saw me and my wife. I must say, this has happened many times when we lived in Chicago and toured through the Midwest; but when we moved to SoCal some years ago the attitudes of the people there were different, much more pleasant, more friendly, and not showing any visual signs of jealously, envy, racism, or hate. Since moving to Vegas, this has only occurred a few times and usually with women who felt they were attractive and had issues with the relationship between my wife and I. Well, not much different at Windy City. These women not only made both my wife and I feel uncomfortable, they caused my wife to loose her appetite and she ordered nothing. I wish this wasn't the case, but it's obvious those women working at Windy City were jealous and more than likely, racists.   Goodbye, Windy City! We tried and I even tried again hoping the food would be the defining parameter.

fps6KaZ75qGW_15bcuYcDg.text: This place has amazing hot dogs! They are so good, that even if I am full when I come here, I can still eat it because of how great if is.  That is definitely one thing you should come here for. But why come for one thing, when you can come for all the delicious things they have to offer?       They have fries that come with your hot dog (if you order them) which taste so good, that you won't even need to put ketchup! They aren't too salty, but they aren't undersalted.      They also have chicken wings which are not tossed in any sauce yet. You can request for many different sauces to dip them in. This includes, hot sauce (mild, medium, or hot), blue cheese dressing, and ranch dressing. Personally, I recommend the hot sauce.      Their service here is absolutely fantastic! The people here are kind and always in good mood. Your food comes out in a matter of 5 minutes too! I may not know much about other places, but this is my favorite place to get hot dogs, fries, and chicken wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries

-pP4Um6MmxVyDXPKaYB2cg.text: I 100% love this place! They're as good as anything I've had in Chicago and the 16 inch Polish made up Chicago style is crack. I haven't even tried the pizza yet because I'm so obsessed with the Dogs and Italian Beef Combo. Since I moved to LV, I've had a steady stream of friends visit me as they roll through town and this is one of y favorite places to take them. The ambiance is cool, the service very friendly and helpful and the food is always just excellent. If you haven't tried this, GO THERE NOW!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QctkSZAuqYCIxDzFtHoskg.text: OMG!  We are so excited that we finally found a place where we can have all our favorite food from Chicago.  We can't wait to come back and see Crystal again.  She made us feel right at home.  Chi town love for life.....

JvyMC_q1EtEyVoH7ruNJ0g.text: I came here after a staycation on the strip with my husband. He had to have a beef on the way home. We've never eaten here but we know all about the menu because we both used to live in Chicago.   As we approached the counter two young looking girls were at the register. One of them chose to give me dirty looks and whisper about me to the other girl. It was comical and sad at the same time.  I was wearing a bikini with a dress over it. There was cleavage but nothing abnormal in my opinion.  I don't have high rise boobs or anything.  It was clear that this is what she took issue with though.  I was annoyed at how blatant she was with the attitude that I didn't get any food.  I just wanted my husband to eat so we could leave. I've got no time for drama and insecure people in my life.   He had the beef with peppers.  I ate a small piece of the meat.  It tasted pretty close to Portillo's in my opinion.  He said he liked it but that they were missing the proper bread.  He thought it was too sweet and soft. He's probably absolutely correct.  My husband is 100 percent Italian and lived in Chicago all his life until four years ago. He probably had an Italian beef when he was born.   In all honesty, I most likely will not try to come here based on service.  The girls need to control themselves. I didn't see the men behind them staring or pointing so I don't think they had the right to be catty.

nRPLr3zlM4c4ANJmANI7fg.text: Love the real Chicago food. Even the employees remind me of back east people  Always convenient & great authentic Chicago dogs

YwT0_XaHPUgka2BH9PIKSQ.text: Again the best pizza and hot dogs in town hands down. The girls always treat you nice and take care of you. Quick service nice smiles and s always good food. Thanks everyone!!

lHlBRDV-A7RHdebTzGXCmw.text: It's the kind of pizza you want when u crave pizza! Sauce slapped on so thick its leathery... Every bite has just the right crunchiness and although it looks like the sauce will slip off the consistency and thickness keeps it right in place. 2.slices... I bit off more than I can chew, but now I can enjoy this small pleasure again later! Friendly staff...definitely a recomendo if ur in this zipcode!

vMCEh9vAQiJeVb_uHTsKsA.text: I love this place. We stop in every time we are in town. Authentic Chicago style dogs, beefs, and pizza. Close your eyes and you will think you are in Chicago. In a strip mall next to nothing bundt cakes fir dessert. Lots of Chicago sports memorabilia all over the place. Friendly staff. Only downer is I was craving a slice of pizza and they only offer it on weeks. Oh well. Gotta come back tomorrow. Lol. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maxwell dog with fries.

Av1ZDMemRXRP-GbcnrFObg.text: I used to fly from Sin City into Midway Airport in the Windy City two or three time a year. Whether I was arriving or departing I picked up a Char Dog at the Gold Coast. Chicago style, celery salt and peppers too.   We all have our cravings whether it be sweet, sour, spicy, crunchy, fried, baked or frozen; I craved the Gold Coast Char Dog. So powerful a craving g that I actually checked flight times for SWA. Don't judge, I had lots of points and I was off work.   I've driven by Windy City here in Vegas a thousand times and never thought it was a genre of hotdog and not unique to the Gold Coast 1900 miles away but alas, it was a concept, available where ever the the snappy casing hits the steel griddle. Here it's the 18 for one Char Dog and fries or, my favorite, the 19 with two one pound Vienna Hotdogs Chi-Town style.   Unwrapped, there it lay in all its colorful splendor of red tomatoes, green relish, grey celery salt, green peppers, white onion and yellow mustard with just a twinge of black char on the pink dog.   The bite, oh that delectable, delicious reunion of tooth and palette to the juicy, meaty snap ensconced in the steamed bun and all the flavors and textures of the aforementioned. Mmmm mmmm mmmmph!!!   The chew,; so many good flavors, textures coming together in a ballet of pleasure, saliva flowing like the Hoover Dam did in the 80's.   Reunited and it tastes so good!

zF-dqYVNmLYq_CG3NuDTlA.text: The deep dish pizza here is a serious letdown.    The last time I was in Chicago I tried a deep dish I didn't like after taking a bad recommendation.  After seeing all the highly rated reviews from people from Chicago I was seriously excited to try this place.       Here's why I didn't like the pizza: -it wasn't hot when it came to us -the dough tasted generic and store bought; it was simultaneously hard and soggy and not in the good way -the tomatoes on top were flavorless  -even with sausage and peppers, the whole thing was bland and flavorless  I will say that it had a good amount of good mozzarella.  It didn't taste like the cheap waxy stuff.  I wasn't sure I liked the service here either.  I came up to the register to place my order and I don't know...  I just didn't feel welcome.  You should want me to order multiple items and not keep cutting me off before I can.  I mean she wasn't rude but she also wasn't friendly or helpful.  If the menu says "creamy garlic Italian" dressing I say I want that one and you tell me you don't have Italian but I ask what is the creamy garlic Italian and you say it's creamy garlic... that doesn't help me.  In case any of you Yelpers want to know it's basically garlic mayonnaise (taste and consistency).
