Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh salad with a lot of &#34;creamy garlic&#34; which is code for garlic mayo

4TjdiTuqPc4tVEH3hegnkQ.text: I think I can make this a quick one. The relish is spot on good and is a must have for any of the dogs. That might have been my favorite thing about this place.   We only got one dog and I think that was the big mistake because the beef sandwiches weren't that great and I don't want to judge a place with "beef dogs" in the title on their average beef sandwiches.  Basically beef on a hoagie. That is all and you dip it. I was underwhelmed.  The pizza pockets were good but nothing that made me go, well I will be coming back to this place soon.  THE VERDICT: Prices were low and it was the perfect amount of food to hold us over until lunch. That relish though... that is what I really liked. Otherwise this place is good not great, but give a dog a try.

JX9g4rUIOTpMzdOSkAi8KA.text: If you are looking for a fancy dinning place this place is definitely not the most up to date pizza restaurant you can find! BUT, if you are just here looking for great pizza , great people , great sports and Chicago vibe, this is the place to be, it sort of has a dive bar kind of a feel.   I was recommended by a friend for their deep dish pizza! And i think it is one of their best things they have here.. maybe they have other great things like the hot dogs but i didnt try them when i was there. They do look delicious on their yelp pictures though.   I suggest you to call and order ahead for the deep dish pizza, it takes them about 30 plus minutes to make them. Three of us ladies ordered #8 the wings with fries and also a 12 inch deep dish specialty pizza.   The wings came out in about short 5 minutes, the buffalo sauce is delicious very good with the wings (and also with the pizza when that came out) the bbq sauce felt a bit tangy.     BUT look at the picture of my deep dish pizza! Not super thick bread , it was filled with lots of cheese, sausage and tomato sauce, i would say it is authentic Chicago deep dish, not those super thick bread ones you find else where here in vegas. The 12 inch can feed about three people, we still had two slices left over after the one order of wings and pizza. It is very fulfilling

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9KocEld7ZeqZ0jGum352tg.text: We were in the area on an errand, and decided to stop in for a beef.  I ordered an Italian Beef, wet, and let me tell you...it was JUST like back home in Chicago.  I haven't had a good beef in years.  This was absolutely perfect.  Service was pleasant, although it wasn't anything spectacular, and the prices seem a little high to me, but they're not astronomical.   The location is easy to find, and was clean.  I love the decor, all Chicago.    We will likely stop back in for some pizza soon!!

qxj1AYhANUVNoiSOHnSkeg.text: Good stuff! If you're from Chicago this place will resonate with you.  Pizza with the toppings on the inside of the pie, not the top. Lots of cheezy goodness and what appears to be homemade sausage.  Great place to watch Chicago teams play sports on the tube.

R96EBXq8N1B7mVuwHgY7DA.text: So hit and miss with this place.  Consistency is not their forte.  I stopped in and got food to go.  I asked for a beef super wet and when I got home, I found I have a beef super dry, why?  Today the hot dogs were good and the bread was fresh, which was a nice change from last time when the buns tasted old and hard.  Maybe if we can get some competition on this side of town they would pay more attention to consistency.    Being from Chicago I have things I desire from home.  I guess I'll have to drive and find another place that is more consistent on the orders.

eyYwELKFLdfCOvbLnQKWNg.text: This place is absolutely adorable! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, owner is back there hustling alongside his staff and making it a fun environment. The restaurant is very clean and the food is excellent. The hotdog good be perfect if they used a better bun but the pizza is incredible! I'm going back for that ASAP!

vi8KVCu9fSx-9tjqNAe0Bw.text: Disappointing experience trying to use Groupon purchase. But when we stopped by to use it on lunch, they declined the $15 voucher and said that we'd have to apply it to a specific meal. The frustrating thing is that the manager at the time couldn't even tell us the price of the meal. We gave up and left.  I have no idea if the food is good, but the customer service drove away customers.

7d5RjQqLCBz-rjCqBzgpJQ.text: The pizza is meh and now Vegas has a Giordanos selling real Chicago style pizza. I had a polish here.. they claimed a Maxwell Street Polish.. It was a large hot dog. LMFAO.. This was the second time I tried this place. The first I had a hot dog. Met. Never again.

SzxaB7oWwa767LgOUg1QIg.text: Thanks to Michael K hosting his first UYE, I was able to experience the friendly service and awesome wings and pizza of this SE Chicago deep dished pizzeria.  The restaurant is located in a large strip mall on S.Eastern Ave and Silverado Ranch Blvd, so finding exactly where it is could be a minor challenge.  But that also meant there are plenty of parking to go around when you go.  By the time I arrived after going to WCBNP straight from work, the chicken wings were already at the table and the group was waiting for the Chi-Town deep dish pizza (which of course took longer to bake).  The wings were really good (I am not even sure what flavor wings were ordered, but that was the highlight for me.  The deep dish pizza that was brought to our table was big.  Really big.  Not sure if I could even finish it all if I was given two meals to attempt to eat it all solo.  The pizza is cut up into squares, so it is messy work eating the middle pieces.  Fork, spoon, spork, offset spatula would all be very helpful in eating this as cleanly as possible.  Having plenty of napkins to mop up the delicious oils on your hand afterward will help too.  Price was really affordable.  With our small group it was like $5 a person for the wings and pizza.  Can't beat that!  I can't see myself coming here solo to have pizza, but the wings are well worth the drive to this east side pizzeria.  Especially on Tuesdays with their $0.50 wings promo with a minimum order of 6.  Who is going to organize the next event here?

SfnG6E_mpO5Y7pv7ELQhyg.text: This is by far the best place in Vegas to have authentic Chicago dogs!! And to top it off? Everything else is delicious too!!! They have hot wings, fries, pizza (both thin crust and deep dish) and sell beer by the buckets!!! Can someone please say perfection!?!?  The place is always super clean, the brightly painted walls are covered in Chicago sports teams jerseys, photos, etc. & has tv's everywhere for all to enjoy! Gets pretty crowded w/Bears fans during the games & theyve got drink/app specials & raffles goin on at this time too! Staff is always very friendly and accurate, service is speedy & smiles all around.    Its not in the best location, as its tucked in an inside corner of a strip mall kind of hidden from main roads, so look hard for this place, bc its Definately worth checkin out!

BBfYfC7-MLzjdfmpMuis-w.text: Love this place and have been going there since it opened! Rather disappointing though that they don't have a kids menu! I see a lot of families in there and I'm surprised nobody has mentioned this before! We were in there tonite with our grandkids ages 2 and 4 and fir hotdogs and beef sandwiches it was $43! And the kids only ate half their food!  Too bad Windy City isn't more family friendly!

OyqR4q0_w88UQvZhjgr8mA.text: OMG this place is the best for Chicago food. And if you are looking for a place to watch Chicago sports on Vegas you have to come here ngrb bite to eat too. Tim is awesome! It's got great Chicago decor and hot dogs, beef and pizza just like home. Of course they have beer too. Stop in sometime and get a beef sandwich- you won't be disappointed.

4B9amsccMgSK6WL296gwIQ.text: Pretty darn good! Once in a while I crave a deep dish slice. Deep dish here is  bit messy but pretty good. Stopped by for some takeout in the evening and got a small plain ("cheese") deep dish and an order of wings.  If you come here for lunch, you can get slices, in the evening hours you can only get a pie. Tuesdays are 50 cent wings and they have pretty good deals other days as well. Be sure to pick up a deal calendar if you intent on coming back.  Now to the nitty gritty, like I said the deep dish is pretty good. The dough is nice and fluffy and the edges are perfectly crusty. The pizza has chunks of sweet tomatoes and sauce on top, I prefer pizza with rather sweeter sauce so it was great for me. My bf hates to eat tomatoes and I thought he wouldn't like it but he did! He also loved the winds and came back for more the next day. The wings come in a variety of flavors but you should know that they are not tossed with the sauce. The sauce comes on the side. I though that would be a deal breaker for my bf since he is very particular about his wings but again, he loved it! His satisfaction definitely speaks to the quality of the food here.

Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Chicago wall

F-Lgej1oTDIIx2-124YEpg.text: This is going to be a tradition every time I visit Vegas. Deep dish was so delicious!

nyo2yyMg4p9QqZ7W5J-OGA.text: We found this spot on Yelp after randomly having a taste for Chicago-style food. We were staying on the Vegas strip so the drive was a little hike but I'd say it was worth it. We were greeted by a nice lady at the counter who happily took our order of all Italian beefs with hot giardinera (so much for variety). The food came out quickly and was hot & fresh. The sandwich put me more in the mind of a higher quality Al's Beef sandwich and is probably the best I will get until I'm able to make it back to Chicago. The fries were also pretty tasty but were outshined by the sandwich, of course. Another group ordered a pizza while we were there and it looked pretty good. They menu also consisted of all the Chi-town staples like dogs, Italian sausages, gyros, and pizza puffs. I'd definitely suggest this to anyone in the area looking for some good Chicago eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Beef sandwich dipped with hot giardinera... Spicy goodness!

KRxCPGSzQ2Wxbi00BmWl_g.text: Came here after I got a glowing recommendation from a friend and have been hooked ever since.   Each time I have called in to-go orders for several of their deep dish pizzas for my family before hitting the road to Cali. They keep very well in a hot/cold bag during the trek home and heats up just fine in the oven.   I've never been to Chicago but these are the best damn deep dish pies I've ever had. My usual is the WCBNP Loaded deep dish which comes with: Italian sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, green peppers, black olives & giardinera peppers (hot or medium). I get two pies, one with the hot giardinera peppers and one with the medium. The hot isn't super spicy but it has more kick than the medium ones and come with less green bell peppers. I believe you can also buy jars of their peppers at the front counter as well.   The cashier is always pleasant and patient over the phone as I'm placing my order. She also gave us a calendar showing us various promotions and specials. Super nice and welcoming. My food is always ready or is being finished up by the quoted pick up time. I cannot recommend this place enough to my friends and family.

6D3TrMlp_VtrjigX5l9FdA.text: Ahhh ok.. customer service could be a little better here... especially when you are from the midwest usually super friendly and talkative... here you seem to be wasting someones time while small talking waiting for food. And fries are over cook and salty... but a hot dog is a hot dog so couldn't really go wrong... will visit hot dog haven better food friendlier just a little further but worth it!

t_UFqwMLwgKFEc4lZZC9oA.text: It's been six months that I've been eating thin crust pizza from Windy City. It was time to delve into the Deep Dish. I've eaten the sausage ($18.75), and two specialty pizzas ($21.50): WCBNP and the meat lovers. All are great, but the meat lovers is my favorite. The deep dish here isn't overly thick which I love because I like a good crust to sauce to toppings ratio. They get it right. The crust is buttery and delicious; it crisps beautifully so it can support the weight of the toppings (weak crust is another pet peeve). Toppings are fresh and so many combinations are possible. And it reheats well in the oven or toaster oven.  They have 50-cent wings on Tuesdays. I've finally tried those now, too. They are meaty, never greasy, yet super crispy. My preference is the Chicago hot, with no ranch or blue cheese. It has a nice kick and it's loaded with flavor. It's nice to actually taste hot wings.  They've had awesome specials for Blackhawks games, like buy a pizza, get one free. And coming up July 4th. They'll have .99 dogs (at both locations) with a soft drink purchase. Talk about a deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings with Chicago Hot on the side.
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Dog
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage Deep Dish

5YlObrAUtUJv4Xk4Uv0XMQ.text: Located in the Silverado Ranch Plaza at Silverado Ranch and Eastern.  Look for Office Depot and Yummy Grill. Love the sports memorabilia all over the walls, the Cubs, the White Sox, the Bears, the Bulls, the Black Hawks, pictures of the great landmarks of Chicago. There are a few binders filled with old memories from Chicago for you to look through but I think there were all just black and white printing from online.   I love deep dish pizza so instant 4 star.  I've already gone to Chicago and ate the good stuff a number of times but I'm far from any expert on the stuff.  A New Yorker might say MEH cause it's not NY pizza.  A Chicagoan might say MEH cause it's not as good as back home.  Honestly I'd say we're not in Chicago or New York we're in Vegas/Henderson :) Don't be offended everyone I haven't read anyone reviews but heard how some think when it comes to pizza.  I enjoyed it enough to go once on Friday that a few days later on a Monday.  It's not a fancy pizzeria that you dress up for and pay high prices.  It is just a good pizza, really the ingredients to make a pizza are literally 1/4 of the price everyone else charges for. Their deep dish is plenty filling like how a deep dish should be.  Thick, gooey, and made to be eaten with a knife and fork or hands if I was at home.  The sauce was a little too sweet for me and I would've loved to have a more buttery crust but all in all cooked properly together with some good ingredients it made a very satisfying pizza. Lots of cheese, meat, and sauce in a deep dish crust you can never go wrong.  They also made a thin crust which also wasn't that bad. They were cut into squares and about the thickness of a "regular" pizza. Not very thin and extra crispy like other thin crusts I've had.  Their pizzas are good especially when you get them on day where they're selling it at buy one get one free, check their calendar for daily specials.  If you don't really know what kind of pizza to order just order their WCBNP Pizza thin crust or deep dish it's a mixture of various ingredients or just keep it simple with cheese, meat, and sauce in a deep dish.  M-F during lunch they serve deep dish by the slice for $4. The slice is almost a quarter in size of the whole thing. With these try to get here early when their fresh out the oven cause it does sit and they when they warm it up it the crust might get hard.    There have 2 hotdog for $1 and often offer free Chicago dog to anyone named whatever random name they put up on the board. There's multiple large flat screen TVs throughout the restaurant for watching sports. Cheese cake on a stick. There's lots of space inside. If you want to sit outside in the shared patio with other business at night they'll setup some light to see. Good service and reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single slice of sausage deep dish pizza. $4 during lunch M-F

qFtyrzfuj7veoPEfvd7fEw.text: This gem is one I tell all my friends and family who come visit Vegas! I am simply in love with this place!!! Atmosphere and staff = fun, energetic, friendly. But not the kind of friendly you typically expect. They are looking to form real friendships/bonds with their customers. I've been here twice and I can already tell that they truly value their patrons. They have a lot of regulars and I don't blame them!   First time, we had the Chicago style deep dish pizza with Italian sausage, mushroom, and onions. And oh man, SO GOOD!!! I have to tell you that I've sampled Chicago style everywhere -- from LA to SF to Chi town! And I have to say that this is on par -- if not better -- than the ones I tried in Chicago! Everything is well-balanced, cheese is OOEY-GOOEY GOODNESS, and they do not skimp on the meat. Everyone who knows pizza... knows that toppings are important, but what is equally important is the crust! And boy, this one delivers. Its soft, flavorful, yet crispy.   I can't wait to try the hotdogs and gyros next!   I recommend eating the pizza there though. I took one to go and though it was still good... it wasn't as good as when we sat there and dined in. Reheating in the oven helps a bit! But it is best right out the oven!   Also, my bf is a huge Chicago Cubs fan -- and I think we found THE spot to watch games. I love the atmosphere. Everyone is a die-hard fan of anything Chicago! It makes all games that much more fun to watch amongst Chicagonians.

qQ4_b-eaHp37gwrtlsM9FQ.text: We've been here once before and it was ok. Decided to try it again for a pickup order and couldn't get past the rude lady on the phone. Some of the worst customer service I've ever had and I didn't even finish my order. Treat me like dirt and you won't get my business. Called the next day to speak to the owner/manager and the same rude lady said he couldn't talk. She was just as rude during this 2nd call. Sad thing is that I think this is a family run business and with such horrendous customer service, They may not be in business much longer.

93HTdZyieCRajQmH1k4Ebg.text: If you're from River Grove just west of Chicago and like Gene & Jude's, then  you'll like the hot dogs here. And no ketchup ! They know way too many things about the right way to make a hot dog & you can tell they're from Chi Town. Great dogs  without the fear of getting mugged out  in the parking lot like back in the day down in Chicago on Maxwell street .

_d83RUKe9vv9aYOApwgl2w.text: Great local, family owned shop. Staff is great and the food is excellent! Our family of four each had a different sandwich and all were splendid! Highly recommend.

pc9lvQEQvKf72jaR0hDbjA.text: The pizza is authentic Chicago style and the best I've had outside of my own kitchen. The deep dish and thin crust pizzas are excellent. Solid flavor on the sauce. The dogs are great as well.

eVpN17zA-PL3qfoZ_GBvGg.text: Finally came in to check this place out.  WHY didn't I come here earlier. This place is great.  Not a Chicago sports fan but I can ignore the decor haha.  The service was very friendly.... I got the #4 best of both worlds.  It's a Chicago dog, Italian beef sandwich and fries.  The Chicago dog was pretty good, but that Italian beef... Holy Crap that was delicious.. Got it with cheese, peppers and gardinera (sp) dipped.. Not sure if it was the jus dripping or if I was just uncontrollably drooling cause that was AMAZING.  I will most definitely be back here.

BbspsAiMrh18S2lv5wmmPg.text: Great Chicago food. The beef are out of this world with the hot peppers. Had a dog with the works today.  The only thing they could improve on is the fries. Today they were soggy, but last time they were just right. Going to try the 50 cent wings next Tuesday .

2p_uG8vTCSpEe9IyiL5FNQ.text: Ordered two hot dogs with fries, the hot dogs were great but the fries smelled like fish. A recommendation to the owner please cook your fries in oil dedicated to fries. The four star rating is for the hot dogs. I maybe could give the fries 1/2 a star at best.

awNOHLxHksI0MtblzqsB9g.text: Amazing restaurant, so happy we found this gem about a year ago! The deep dish sausage pizza is our favorite, full of flavor and amazing dough for the pizza crust. The #5 is our go to for a quick bite, always delicious! The best part about this place is the staff and environment. Everyone is always nice friendly and helpful, and there's even a place to enjoy your food outside on a cute patio area! All around best Chicago food by far!

kqD5CDgsJ0xpWthnu90VOA.text: Great place to grab some chicago bites. Having tried the italian beef, chili dog, and deep dish pizza here i have enjoyed all 3 so far. Also makes a good lunch spot as they have deep dish by the slice and a selection of hotdog and beef sandwhich combos.

GTEvS1FqT80O2xrtLjGzgA.text: All I can say is that the customer service over the phone was very rude. The woman kept asking me to repeat myself louder and louder then scolded me to "not yell" at her. Then she had me repeat my credit card number at least 5 times even though she had the correct number. Also, don't call me "hon". In the end, I would not want to call here again and deal with their customer service even if the pizza is good.

xAs0hVQXI3NVSPvJWlvNHA.text: My first time visiting today for lunch.  I had the corned beef sandwich which was good (saurkraut was a little salty) and a bite of their Italian beef sandwich and that was good too.  The serving size is large and prices were great.  I will split a meal next time. Definitely suggest to my friends to try it out.

ZjY5z7Hih5m12kodXNnKkw.text: Best Italian Beef in Vegas, hands down!! Chicago dogs and pizza are fantastic as well!

Fi7XBHemrK9BDNDtUL016Q.text: It's the closest pizza shop to our home, and the best.  Staff is great and pizza is excellent.  We love both the thin and deep dish.

hUxjwZhCyMSLfv0uX_6adg.text: I've never been to Chicago, so perhaps I'm a tad baised to this favorite place of mine. It's a utterly comfortable hang-out for lots in this neighborhood, and it's always busy- full of happy, well-fed former Chicagoans and those in the know. My faves have to be the thin pizza, the Italian beef dipped sandwiches (so so good!) and the surprise of them all, the best canolli for dessert I've ever ever had. Yes, better than Freed's in the same shopping center. The cream inside the shells seems to me..to be made with powdered sugar, so it's very smooth and silky. Just amazing! Plus, everyone who works here is so friendly and provide great service. You go, and have a happy tummy!

tgPI4pO-WQ9gUjUK9q2eWA.text: I'll start with the bad then go on.  Mainly because there isn't too much bad. The girl working isn't very friendly.  Instead of a Chicago style pizza place she should work at a NY style pizza place.   Anyways, we move on.  I wanted to try out a Chicago style pizza place since it's been a long time.  It was A-OK in my book.  They do a nice job with the pizza. We used a groupon so we got a good deal. Came with two salads large pizza and two cannoli's.  We didn't realize how big that pizza was.  We were lucky to be able to take it back to the hotel b/c we had a refrigerator.  Otherwise way too much food for two people.  Could easily fead four or five people.  We didn't even take the cannoli's b/c we had too much food.  Also - I've never eaten them so I didn't want to waste the food in case I didn't like them. The place is simple but there is Chicago memorabilia everywhere.  If you're a packer or redwing fan you may not like it.  - j/k - place is pretty cool.

phH4W6qvJdC0ZE_qBTOqHw.text: I am from Chicago so I would be able to tell you if a place is good or not! Windy City is definitely the best Chicago place to go to in town. Whether you're a native, a visitor from Chicago or just want to get a taste of the city, you won't be disappointed here. The staff and owner are all extremely friendly and kind! They make an effort to come over and treat you as if you've been going there for all your life. They always have Chicago sports on and they do a free raffle on game days and jello shots during the game! Extremely fun atmosphere for all ages and all those who enjoy midwestern hospitality! The delicious food is just an added bonus!

ZmqCA4dH--N-YNPuBU4tbA.text: Good pizza, thin style and chicago style, Fun place with awesome Chicago brick decor. Friendly staff. There's a few things restaurants should never charge their customers....like ranch sauce for French fries, not good.

QaX_ri9XityYnmKUxIKTcw.text: Giving two stars because the lady at the counter was a total sour puss. We got no welcome, no smile. We asked about pizzas and she was bitchy about that like how dare we ask about a slice....after lunch. When she brought our food to the table, she literally plopped it down and walked away. No "enjoy" no thank you...terrible service. You just served a chef and an event planner. Guess who I WILL NOT recommend? The hot dog was good and had a nice little snap and the roll was good. It could've used more green relish, in my opinion. I'd like to try a pie, but might not return because of the service. Everyone else got a hello, a thank you, a "what part of Chicago are you from?" We stood at the counter, looking at the menu and my associate was saying he'd like a dog but no fries, repeatedly. She never offered up the info that he could do that so I asked and she simply said, "3 and a quarter." Not, "sure, we can do that."  Not a nice thing about how she treated us. Not one. Terrible service.

qTXQ0Voun_nXlS1b9V0Vgg.text: Loved their Italian beef sandwich with sweet peppers, cheese, served wet. The employees are very nice, also liked the atmosphere to talk and enjoy lunch with friends.

BV1tN6hOhtOkHvhc1uqk_g.text: Their thin crust was horrible! The dough was bland, dry and so tough my kids couldn't bite through it. The sauce tastes of what I remember kids lunchables "pizza" tasted like. Staff member was not helpful at all when I told her it was my first time. Her response when I asked her for her recommendation was, "we have pizza and hotdogs."

0jvji_pAI735HkMBo_NRrw.text: No need to search further.  Real Chicago Deep Dish Pizza.  Great decor and Chicago sports memorabilia,  even though I'm originally from rival St. Louis.  Friendly staff and reasonable prices.

iCT_B3e4KerdK4lRd-idHQ.text: As someone who has a current CTA Chicago Card Plus at the time I write this I know a thing or two about some things Chicago. And I have to admit I like Windy City Beefs N Pizza. I haven't tried their pizza yet....which as a Pizzaholic means I'm seriously slacking. (And if Jaime W. recommends it, I gotta try it!) But when I only had time for a fast lunch Windy City's #4 Best of Both Worlds 3 Inch Beef Sandwich and a classic Vienna Beef hotdog with no obnoxious ketchup fit the bill just fine. And unlike stopping at a cart along the street Windy City has tables to sit at so you can take your time and enjoy your food.   This is a nice little slice of Illinois right here in Vegas. Well worth your time to check out.   (Yelp 100 in 2013 Challenge #14)

E2pVpFT6l09GRh3wQ_qkZg.text: To start off my review of the most immaculate pizza I've had in a while, I'll paraphrase the 2001 classic, one barely edged out by A Beautiful Mind to win Best Picture of that year, Legally Blonde.  Pizza gives you endorphins, endorphins make you happy. Happy people just don't shoot their husbands. They just don't.  I couldn't agree with this sentiment more, except I would probably seriously maim anybody who tried to stand in the way of me and this pizza.   Deep dish is a while wait, but when you've got a place to sit outside, good company, and Nothing Bundt Cakes next door, what's the problem? Wait for the feast you're about to embark on.  A huge selection of toppings and of combos for Chicago dogs. The deep dish is crispy but then doughy towards the middle just the way it should be. I snarfed 3 pieces before I realized that I may go into cardiac arrest before the day was done. Then I ate the leftovers (heated up in the oven like bosses do) for dinner the next day and I was in heaven all over again.  The place is small but the owners are CRAZY nice and their service excellent. As Jaime mentioned, it's hard to cut with plasticware but next time I'll come prepared with a metal fork and knife. No really, I probably will.

VoEOzxiQ5x258Hf5Lmvh9g.text: Been twice and I'll go back again. Why? First off the customer service. They are actually nice here. I used to put up with another pizza place in the area; that place had hung up on me and are impatient. None of that here. Thin crust is cut into squares. The middle pieces are hard to eat. Maybe get cutlery. Make sure you have tons of napkins and cover your clothes. Loads of delicious oil drips off. Meat special is loaded with pepperoni, sausage, bacon and ground meat. The pepperoni is so good. It actually tastes so good you try to find pieces with more of them. The ground meat contrasts with a barely seasoned taste, just meaty. I don't remember running into much bacon, but this pizza was good. Chicago Style Italian Sausage comes in mild and hot. I opted for mild and got it wet. The bread is soggy but dense enough to hold up. It's loaded with sweet peppers. You can also get a side of marinara which I not only put in my sandwich, but dipped my fries in. Good stuff! Like the pizza eating this sandwich was a messy experience, but tasty. Grab a calendar. They have random deals, things like if your name starts with the letter "g" you get a discount. They are active on Facebook facebook.com/WindyCityBe... There's plenty of seating and a television to keep you busy while you wait. The bright yellow walls and the light covers might entertain you too.

GmqfIbi7MRKilfz1LJrbTQ.text: You can't go wrong here. Beef sandwich is really good, I think it's the best in town. Hotdogs a great as well add $.50 wings on Tuesday and you can't go wrong. The employees are super nice as well!!!

Chdk86u-hThrUOzm137Bng.text: Love this place. A True Chicago spot if there ever was one. Great food, and their place is very clean and well lit. Love the Chicago dogs.

JA8FJ_WcNC7RVQ7n_1bN2g.text: Hit Windy City on a return trip from AZ back to Mountains Edge - I was hankering for some pizza and i remember seeing a recent posted review and pics of windy city so why not give it a try ?  I'm a fan of the Chicago style thin crust pizza so i opted for a medium with sausage and pepperoni.  Also picked up a foot long chili dog ( includes a sack of fries )   The pizza  - nice crunchy crust with the graininess of the added cornmeal bottom ( which i like ) the sausage tasted great, probably a little more cheese than i prefer but not a bad thing.  The sauce - decent - strong oregano  taste.  And as usual, i dig the square cut as opposed to the standard slice cut.  The chili dog - a tasty mess !  Homemade chili ( no beans ) onions, cheese and mustard - ALL GOOD.  The sack of fries - nothing special.  Total cost - $26.50 ( not sure of breakdown cost between pizza and chili dog )   Price seems a little high so i've dinged them one star.  Overall, I like the place and may try again if in the area.

mR0qfhhzgzYdhPF5d6KQ9w.text: I have finally changed my idea of the perfect pizza, I'm now hooked on deep dish! The 30 minute  wait was WELL worth it. Between me and my husband we were barely able to finish half the pizza. We also had cannolis and they are by far the best i've had, so crispy and just perfect. This has become a favorite!

ERPjXHPQCjqgxr3zBYoaaA.text: My quest for amazing pizza continues and I must say I'm getting close!  After reading solid reviews from LV Weekly and Seven I figured it was worth a visit.  Tucked away in a strip mall of off Eastern Ave (billed by me as the best road outside of the strip to find good eats), I feel Chicago authenticity when I walk in.  Just like the Vienna sausage company HQ in Chicago, IL, Windy City has yellow walls and plenty of Chicago maps and memorabilia.  The pizza comes in two Chicago styles, a thin crust or deep dish.  This time around I ordered the thin crust which had very melty cheese (not rubbery) and a good amount of sauce and well seasoned toppings.  As an app we had winds with a medium sauce, they didn't look good at first, but they were just the right amount of crisp and the sauce was a nice kick.   This isn't the normal sorta light and dry thin crust you come to expect at Sammie's or CPK and while I still enjoy those places, I must say that Windy City takes the crown.  Next-up: Deep Dish!

iz-pqzT2gk9xMf1PQgTZPA.text: Been looking forward to trying this place, since I owned a similar place (Chicago Hot Dogs) in Nor Cal several years ago. First off - the snot, rude (see Brittany N review) lady behind the counter - are you kidding me? Who do you think you are? I almost walked out, she was such a B**ch. Hands my change back to me, and I say thanks. She says nothing, turns away. I asked the kid - hey did I piss her off by coming in? Got my food and left. I am going back, and if she acts like that again I am going to unload on her verbally. 2 can play the pissy game, lady!

Td4I8ETAvB5qEZkcmUnRtA.text: I ordered the wings and fries and the pizza I've had better why do people use Chicago for a selling point in Vegas I don't understand it go back home this is the west coast.....and the wings are basic nothing fancy how can they be Chicago wings when my wife make Better wings then this place pathetic and the lady who takes your order I mean damn go get some teeth every body looking at me weird cause I have a red wings hat on I don't like this place had better food other places don't waster your food or gas cause I live 30 mins away and drove here...I mean the cashiers voice is so loud I can here her voice across the room Jesus lady quiet it down your friend is right next to you not across the room

GdQqSFZP22UM2pZq3G_8Uw.text: Yum, yum, yum!  I am from Chicago and this is the real deal. I love all of the Chicago memorabilia around this place. They always have specials going on as well. I haven't tried the pizza yet, but it sure looks good! The gyros are good, but not great. I prefer the gyros from a nearby Greek restaurant. But, their combo with sausage and beef, yum!  You can order in three ways from what I remember. If the bread isn't falling apart all over the place, you didn't order it the right way!  I love my bread dunked in the gravy, nice and messy and super tasty!  Employees are always super friendly, we will be back for sure!

ZbOHDORDPd5gRIQcyWwDFA.text: Delicious WINGS! non breaded deep fried goodness!! Pizza was tasty but did not have enough sauce and a little too much cheese, which I normally wouldn't mind but it was a tad bit dry.

R96_3vlDpHA640mZg_2aeQ.text: My 11 y.o. son and I ate lunch here today for the first time. He ordered the Chicago dog with everything on it. The nice lady taking our ordered informed us there was hot peppers on it and it might be too spicy. We agreed to leave the peppers off. When we were almost done, she noticed my son was upset and brought him a plane hot dog, no questions asked.  When I got my Diet Coke refill I told her thank you and she was concerned he didn't like it and that is why she brought the plane dog. I explained to her he was upset about something else. I have not been anywhere else in Vegas where an employee had as much compassion and constant observation to make sure we enjoyed our meal. We will definitely be back and appreciate the kindness!!

Tgb7m0Nj96Zixh5_LiB13w.text: This place is great!  I ordered the Italian beef, deep dish pizza and the pizza puff. The italian beef is delicious. It tastes just like how it is in Chicago. Being a chicago native, I had to check this place out. The deep dish is really good. They give you a lot of food for your money. They even sell oke doke popcorn and jays chip products.   This is definitely going to be my permanent place if I want some good italian beef. Overall, I give 5 stars because this place was really clean and the food was hot and fresh.

Wu6R7FE55dRMYr87Ue_j-g.text: I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time. I lived in Chicago for a few years so I was really craving some deep dish. I call to place my order and a female employee answers. Right from the start she spoke to me in a condescending tone and even made fun of me. After her doing that a couple times i asked her if that was how she treated customers, cussed her out, and hung up on her. No way I'm getting treated like I'm stupid when I'm trying to give you my money.

E1gyQ1EDggu9vudcqbcaog.text: Italian beef  (wet)  is the best IN TOWN  So is their Deep dish Pizza !!!!  Don't waste your time driving around on the west side for Chicago food !!! Pizza Puffs are Awesome !!!

GElx_NnVvPFQ1xXkD3fq8g.text: Deep dish pizza was good. Perfectly seasoned and not too salty. Perfect crust!   Chicago dog was served wrapped for in dining and way too small and expensive but has a great flavor. Cashier should've mentioned the special for 2 Chicago dogs, fries and soda for $7.50 instead of $5.00 one small Chicago dog.   They could've used real utensils instead of plastic for in dining, especially for deep dish pizza!

SokMLptDohw77bhuCEC6sQ.text: Awesome Chicago deep dish pizza!! The crust is so good! Crunchy and buttery with the right amount of dough. Will be ordering from again.

4UzL3RFG1mw55S2iVm8N5A.text: Best Pizza in Vegas!!!  I had the thin crust pizza and hot wings.   Wings were spot on too, but the pizza is exactly what I've been looking for in the 3 1/2 years I've been in Vegas. There were some other diners having the Chicago style deep dish and they looked very happy too. I found this place by complete chance. I was trying to make a u-turn inside the target parking lot, when this place caught my eye. So I thought I'd give it a shot. As I walked in, the place was well lit, clean, spacious, and inviting atmosphere. They got extra points for having several flat screens with the game on.   I'll be back for sure

4ZxhPPItaq2UDEftDfSOpA.text: Just moved in town, called in for delivery and was responded to in a condescending way.  I hate when people are rude on the phone especially if I'm spending $30 on a individual one topping pizza wings and fries.  Other then that the food was good

osFGEJVGBlQBeqWhIc3pXw.text: Cool little place to eat. The Italian beef was really good and tasted just like some of my favorite places in Chicago. They didn't have cheese sauce for the fries, which is always a must when in Chicago. The deep dish pizza tasted great, but the I prefer the toppings to be placed first, then cheese, and then sauce. Will definitely be back.

OImnoR2XpTa3K6aV2k_a5A.text: Wow, wish I would have tried this place sooner!  I had the Italian beef and sausage sandwich, so good, messy, but worth it! Special thanks to Sasha for bringing me here! Very friendly staff and owner too. Yum yum

7trx-VERRZK6sZwiOW8yRg.text: Winner, congratulations you have earned one star. If this review was just for the food I would have given them 4. Guess you don't want to catch them on a bad attitude day. Shame how one experience can lose a customer. Long story short (after a bunch of hassle and attitude) they left an item out of our to go order. Went back and they pretty much called us liars. We have eaten and enjoyed several of their pizzas. Threw the menu away and won't be going back. Fortunately there are lots of pizza restaurants in town that serve pizza without the attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t need the menu anymore as I will never darken their door again. Shame their attitude doesn&#39;t match the quality of their food.

1OIcPdmvDVCv6v-Yl41pXA.text: Diane and I tried Windy City Beefs N Pizza for the first time and found its Italian Beef Sandwich and Chicago Dog to be as good as what is served at its sister property, Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs.  But her Canadian Bacon & Extra Cheese Pizza was burnt, very thin, inexplicably cut into small squares, and fairly pedestrian.  Money for the pizza was refunded after Diane turned down an offer for a new pizza, but a Corn Dog replacement was accepted.  No problem here, except the cashier refused to take any additional money for the Corn Dog.    A #4 Windy City's Best of Both Worlds featuring a Vienna Beef Chicago Dog and a 3-inch Beef Sandwich yielded just the right amount of food to assuage my hunger.  The dog's relish was emerald green with zippy Sport Peppers, while the lean beef was tucked inside a soft bun with sweet Green Peppers and melting white cheese just dripping in juices.  Service, too, was excellent.

DmU3Ekt7jGTq3rHAhKAe2g.text: I do love there food but the only people that were really welcoming is the older staff and I didn't like how the cashier was counting her tips in front of customers!! How unprofessional!

9442amNpSB-QFwU_liCoyQ.text: SO THIS IS WHAT YOU CHICAGOANS ARE USED TO!  I bookmarked this place because of all the check ins I see from my Yelp friends! If that many people just from my friends list go here, then it must be good! So the very first chance I got im all over it!  I asked the lady behind the counter what was good. She smiled and said everything. I asked what was good for a first timer. She said either the thin crust pizza or the Italian Beef or Sausage. So as my first ever order I went with the #13 Combo which was Italian Beef and Sausage on a roll which comes with fries and a drink. I also opted for the mozzarella cheese and sweet peppers. She asked if I wanted the sandwich dry, wet, or dipped. HUH? I guess I am a noob. Dry, the sandwich is just that. No sauce whatsover. Wet, they put a little bit of Au jus on the sandwich. Dipped, they literally dip the bottom half of the sandwich in Au jus. This sounded very intriguing so I picked that.   When I got my sandwich, the bottom half of the bread was literally falling apart from the sogginess of the Au Jus. Like the noob I was, I still picked it up and tried to eat it like a regular sandwich. That's when I noticed the plastic fork that came with it. FAIL. Needless to say, it was really good. The Beef and Sausage put together was like Batman and Robin, Shaq and Kobe, Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston.......ok that last one was a bad example. Anyways, you know what I mean. The two meats mixed with melted mozzarella cheese and sweet peppers were fantasmic! (refer to my pic!) The fries were nothing to be excited about.  As I was scarfing down my meal, I noticed from the little cardboard cutout thingies that form a triangle (there were two of them) on the table. One had a picture of a Frozen Chocolate Dipped Cheesecake on a stick! The other said that tuesdays were 50 cent wing tuesdays. Just these two pieces of info alone should be more than enough to warrant another trip or three in the future!  I paid about around 10 bucks for my meal  which definitely filled me up. That was about the average price for any one of their combos.   Since the theme and ambiance was based out of Chicago, of course everything you saw on the walls were nothing but things about the windy city! The overall size of the place was very spacious and the location is sort of tucked away in a nice sized plaza.   I am definitely coming back to try the thin crust pizza and wings, especially on a tuesday! They have specials everyday. The day I went, the special was if your name was Dorothy or Ryan, you get a free hot dog! (with proof of your ID)  So in closing, this is another one of those places that you are glad you checked out for it will be on one of your good grub places to eat list! So yeah, I am definitely a fan!

Photo of Windy City Beefs N Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Covered Cheesecake on a stick? Hmmmm.

YqxRaW61M4nX_eIbAv-l2Q.text: Opted for the wings cuz I have a strong craving. Never tried them here before but SO glad I did! Tried two sauces: hot and Chicago hot. I personally like the hot better, it's traditional whiffle the other is very heavy on garlic. Bomb. I will be back.

n0AN2trTWnbqSBvgt5UA0Q.text: I am from the east coast and accustomed to the best pizza in United States ;) however, Windy City brings a little comfort and reminders of pizza from home.   I had the thin crust Hawaiian and it was pretty good, a bit sweet for my taste but nonetheless still a damn good pizza. I will visit again but if I had a chance to give a suggestion, I would offer a regular crust option.

j9XvJFpz4GDIbLDlWVW88w.text: As of this week, Windy City Beefs in Pizza, is my favorite place for Pizza.  The Pizza reminds me of a really good Geno's East Pizza.  Sausage was excellent and all over the Pizza including the crust.  We got the large deep dish special that included 12 chicken wings.  We devoured as much as we could and still managed to take home half the Pizza.  Infact the Pizza was still excellent the next day!

NrdMb9-d-fZCJI0nucXZlA.text: Great Chicago creations! Their hot dogs are awesome.. very flavorful! The best of both is the way to go! You get a hot dog and a 4inch beef sandwich. Their thin crust pizza is really good. Nice sauce and cut in squares. They play sports games on the TVs and have daily specials and text offers.

dP3k2iugmOu6lZakbJ44SQ.text: I LOVE MALNATI'S pizza in Chicago.  So, we were in Las Vegas - I looked for a place to have deep dish pizzal - Chicago Style.  It took a bit to find this place as it is tucked in to a corner in the shopping center (next to Office Depot) look for the umbrella patio tables.  The people were very friendly and the place was clean and decorated with tons of Chicago stuff.  My husband had the Chicago dog and it was spot on and delicious.  He wanted to try the Maxwell polish too, but was full from the dog.  I tried the deep dish and it was wonderful.  They do a fantastic job on the crust and the cheese.  The tomato could have been a little more chunky (I am used to 6 in 1 course ground).  BUT - this place is great.  I wish them all the best because they have great food and great people serving it.

pKGKJGb09MZmN4-6PoelKA.text: Blonde girl and old lady with the long black hair are completely rude.   Growing up in Chicago, we are nice, personable, approachable and polite. Unfortunately these cashiers are rude, have the worst attitude, and love to roll their eyes. Not to mention turn away their customers.   First visit, blonde girl rolled her eyes various times during check out. She was not presentable and had the worst attitude.   Tonight, we went in a 8:55pm. Being the second time, we were willing to try this place out because we were craving Chicago style food. Unfortunately, the cashier with the long black hair told us "we are closed, I forgot to turn off the sign." However.. it wasn't even 9pm yet.   SO RUDE. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I'M SURE THESE WOMEN ARE NOT FROM CHICAGO. Food was mediocre the first visit, but definitely not worth it with the sassy rude cashiers.   Don't waste your time. GO TO BRANDO'S!! =)

1JF3PRxx4EAd2ai14S2beg.text: Didn't know what to expect walking in here after reading alot of the reviews. Assumed the food would be good but heard some bad things about the staff. Everyone was super friendly and super nice!! That might also be because they have only been open for an hour lol. Large deep dish pepperoni..DELICIOUS..I am not from Chicago so I can't compare it to True Chicago deep dish but the crust was flavorful..unlike some places I have been where all they care about is how thick they can make it....Order of wings...the BEST wings i have had in a looooong time!!! The mild sauce had just enough kick and was super flavorful and I love that they put it on the side so when you get home the wings are still super crispy and not all soggy!! Will definetly be back!!

So you can say I had quite a high expectation. It is a bit tucked away in its location but once you find it its a pretty neat spot themed with Chicago stuff everywhere.   What we ordered: 2 orders of Wings with Fries Meat specialty 14 inch Deep Dish  We killed the wings before even getting the Pizza. (Deep Dish takes half hour to bake) They were great and worth ordering again.   Finally the long anticipated Deep Dish came out and it was HUGE. Loads of meat and cheese, 3 grown males could barely finish two slices.   Was it worth the drive, price and wait? For me, Yes. A must try spot that I highly recommend to all.

Ts8TaDuEGBj0It8Y-Zrbkg.text: My review will be just for the deep dish pizza I had. Got a Groupon for a 14" pizza (w/ 4 choices of toppings). Two salads and two cannolis for $16.99. Get it while you still can! its a phenomenal deal! groupon.com/deals/windy-... The pizza was absolutely delicious. Seriously The Best pizza I have ever had. It looked nothing like the deep dish pizza they had on their menu, but it tasted so good I could care less. The crust was perfection and that comes from someone who doesn't care for crust. The cheese was a wonderful melty, gooey yumminess. I chose mushroom, sausage, pepperoni and green peppers for my toppings. The sauce was perfectly seasoned. It was awesome! The salad was mediocre. Nothing spectacular, but I didn't come for salad so I could care less what the salad was. And for the value I got in the pizza from the Groupon it made up for your basic shredded iceberg lettuce, a few tomatoes, and sliced carrot. I believe the pizza alone would have been $21.50 I was so full after gouging on that fabulous pizza I couldn't fit the cannoli, but I did take a bite of it to taste. The filling was good. Not too sweet. Creamy sweetened cream cheese with bits of chocolate chips. It tasted like cream cheese anyway. I don't think it was ricotta. They have a 50 cent wing Tuesday with a minimum of 6 wings per order. Unfortunately I didn't order any because I knew we weren't going to be able to finish the pizza. The next time in Vegas we are definitely going to stop here for pizza again and hope to try some wings. I will come even if they don't have a Groupon because the pizza is awesome!!

TOULMEm20xB1Ir9HK9wOog.text: This a cute place with friendly staff and good eats!  Tucked away in a little strip mall section in the larger Target strip mall, this all-Chicago themed restaurant serves up pizza (thin and deep dish), hot dogs, wings, desserts, and other items. They also have a food challenge and lots of specials and deals.  You can eat in, take out, or get delivery. You order at the counter, but they will bring the food to your table.  The walls are lined with Chicago memorabilia.  The hot dogs are yummy, the pizza is good, and the wings are decent. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it's solid and I like the deep dish. The wings are small, but a good quality that is cooked well. Skip the side salad - not even slightly worth the money. The cannoli is a good ending to your meal.  All in all, I'll be back a lot.

F6U5L5ITZc50yANd0Gfz_w.text: This was quite possibly the biggest let down I've ever had where food is concerned. My boyfriend hyped this place up so much saying there was nothing better than a hot dog from here.. but he hadn't been here in 10 years. Once I got the Windy City #1 hot dog I expected it to be the best thing on the menu because thats what the place is called, I was sorely mistaken. Everything was mushy and the hot dog tasted boiled, the only thing with a crunch was the pickle and that's all I could taste was pickle. Nothing looked fresh, the bun in fact looked like a corpse and fell apart like one too. In all honesty I could find a better hot dog at circle K. The best place to go is Steamie Weenie if you want a hot dog done right.

rLH1wPQGUs4St1NP54laxA.text: This has become my & my fiance's favorite place for some nearby grub! Great service, fair prices, and amazing Chicago style pizza, subs & dawgs.   Everyone should at least try the pizza!!!!

axrbsiV9aa2Sr-uxO0RB6w.text: My introduction to Italian beef was through the new franchise of Al's Beef over on Sahara and Rainbow. I actually got a little bit of face time on the Yelp Las Vegas home page for that, so I felt the pressure to compare it to this place, which I hadn't tried until today. It helped that I found a Groupon for non-pizza items (so no, this is not at all a pizza review), and I decided to try a few different meats in buns.  First up, the Italian beef (#10). It's in a similar price range to Al's. It seems to be slightly better seasoned and herbed. Unfortunately, it didn't hit the palate quite as hard as Al's did. I think the beef may be a bit better, and the giardiniera looks more authentic and feels that way with the mix of veggies and peppers, but the au jus did not match up to Al's in terms of umami, and I'm thinking the bread may not be as durable. And yes, I got it dipped here as well. Small edge to Al's for just the overall impression.  Second, I had some of the Double Italian Sausage (#12). This is where Windy City Beefs fell flat for me. My comparison this time was to a well known purveyor of foods... which is a Costco food court in Virginia. Yes, they serve an Italian sausage sandwich at Costco on that coast. And yes, I actually would prefer to eat that one again. There was not enough sweetness in the onions and peppers or savoriness in the sausage here, and this one is significantly more pricey.  Finally, I tried a bit of the Polish sausage (#45) with fries. I actually was snacking on the shoestring fries with the other sandwiches, and keeping in mind that taking the fries to-go destroyed the texture (so it's not really the restaurant's fault), I thought the flavor was pretty good. That's all I can really say about that. As for the Polish sausage, it was really good and had so much more flavor than the Italian sausage. Sport peppers weren't actually all that bad for my palate, although they were unexpected. Anyway, this pretty much saved the average.  So, two good options out of three, and maybe future Groupons? I think I could see myself coming back. But I'm still kinda sad that I live way across town from Al's. That's my story and I'm stickin' to it.

PJcm6WTgPpAzcXgubfYBrg.text: Definitely gone down hill in terms of customer service & correct food order & correct deliver locations if you've ordered from different locations  in past...shame we like the food but be sure to double & triple check before you accept your orders!  Tonight's order they delivered diet soda instead of regular then we realize the THREE hotdogs ordered without buns etc for dogs wasn't included but paid for...so then they return with the correct soda and ONE hotdog cut up saying that there were three and we would NOT be charged when in fact we had already paid cash and did not receive a receipt which also is annoying. The delivery guy also said in future orders they wouldn't cut up the hotdogs nor would they be free!  I never asked for them to be cut up & never asked for them to be free although when we first started buying from here the owner GAVE us free cut up hotdogs for my sweet Labradoodle Sonny... We paid for three hotdogs as we now have three dogs and the deliver had one hotdog cut up and only two hotdog ends which was evidence it was only one! Nothing more I hate than a liar! We are done with Windy City!

Next door to Mexican and Asian.  Outdoor seating is available.  We make a point if eating here every time we visit Vegas

7WS20TBGVCSkB2XjnK1RUQ.text: Deep dish, I did not know your were so very delicious! We ordered the WNCCPRKW??? I don't remember the initials, but I do remember stuffing myself to the point of almost asking my man to carry me out!  I asked to come here for dinner because of Jamie W's review. We were so delightfully surprised at how much we loved the deep dish, we can't wait to come back and try the beef! We ordered the large pizza with sausage, mushrooms, onions, black olives, green peppers and giardiniera . It was like a flavor explosion and a delight for all of my senses. The smell of the sauce, the crisp of the crust ( did I taste a hint of butter in that crust?) the crunch of the veggies, the heat of the giardiniera, the creamy meltiness of the cheese. Thank goodness there were leftovers. I just finished a leftover slice and it was as good as last night! The staff was nice, the place was clean. All that was missing was Coke Zero.  Enjoy, in moderation.

tnOAyGTHDtXbTFDi_rKbOQ.text: I tried the deep dish Chicago style pizza and it was delicious. The service is great at this restaurant. The team is very friendly and helpful. Even the customers remind me of the Midwest hospitality. I definitely recommend.

egYLIdp8TJDnvz3d4AnH_g.text: Best Chicago food , The Deep Dish pizza bomb , my favorite is the Chicago style hotdog and Maxwell polish. I will go there always..

waLIFTBHOqacepTLF1fNOQ.text: There was this skinny woman with glasses behind the counter that acted like we ruined her night when we walked in.  To be clear, it was not the new girl that was being trained, it was the one that hated her job, her life, her self, or all of the above.  She practically threw the food down when she brought it to the table.  In all fairness, we did walk in at 8:40 and they close at 9, but if she was in a hurry to close she could have told us that they were closing and we would have been fine eating at the sushi place next door that is open until 11.   The only reason I'm giving two stars is because the food was good.  We ended up finishing our meal at the tables outside where the atmosphere was more pleasant.

oVdptiGU_Tz_28ZWdRSzVw.text: I lived in Chicago for about 5 years, so when someone says "Chicago----" I instantly get my Grumpy Skeptical face on.   Windy City Beefs...well, they have Pizza Puffs. They have neon green relish, sport peppers, no ketchup. Yes, exactly.   I prefer some other "deep dish" pizzas to Windy City, but for dogs and beef and puffs, this place sates the Chicago longing cravings.   Pros: - Good food, good prices, good folk. - Chicago Style Hot Dogs. Done right.  - I like the fries. I seldom like fries. Crispy outside, fluffy within. - PIZZA PUFFS. - My husband can get his Lost Chicago Beef.  Cons: - When it gets busy, there can be a wait. Which...you should really have expected, since it's not fast food. But in case you didn't.... - Pizza has more edge crust and less butter than I like in my Chicago style.

8yOSI_1h-kmRXPfbxWdyaA.text: Had the deep dish and it reminded us of home...lots of cheese and toppings...wings were good as well...both good sizes...quick delivery.... only issue as we see often in these types of places...plastic utensils just don't cut it!!

O0C_HkC80tRnvceEjGlhnQ.text: Used a Group On coupon that was accepted with no problem.  The salad was basic but the lettuce was very fresh and crisp.  Choice of dressings - extremely limited.  Pizza was good if you've never had deep dish in Chicago.  If you have - it was meh.  The crust was good.  Sausage was sparse, onions over abundant. Compared to Las Vegas pizza it was better than most.  The cannolis were good.  I may have been over-charged a few bucks, but didn't quibble.  Service was excellent and folks very nice.  Plastic utensils are a big non-starter.  Atmosphere - basic deli.  Disclosure - I've lived in Chicago and worked at Giordano's so my review might be a bit critical.

sz0XmDM-vCQOlGP26uCm-w.text: From a Chicagoan.....wow. Pretty damn good deep dish pizza.  They did forget my salad dressings for the salads. But fuck it. Didn't really want to waste good stomach real estate on salad anyway. Very very very good.  Will be going back for the Chicago dog and Italian beef sandwiches.

MMtAw3942XHJCnagHI95_w.text: I am thrilled to say the Italian beef is yummy to this gal's tummy! Great sammy, the Polish is fantastic.

2A4buwScWwhwf1vdX7IeHw.text: Excellent pizza with a down home feel. We had the Chicago deep dish pizza and it was exceptionally good. Great beer specials daily as well.

UqQ0H3vKTNpi9tQTcouMLQ.text: I'm convinced that an Italian beef with spicy giardinera double-dipped will run you.for.life. Few things are more delicious, more drippy, gooey, herby, spicy, crunchy. All endorphin receptors firing. Napkins needed for the grass as it creeps down your arms to your elbows. Look, I'm not a professional beef sandwich aficionado but I'd like to think I could be and never gain weight but sadly, I didn't get that get out of food jail free card...me? I think of one and I gain 5 to 10. But eating one, yegods, this one is good and from what I understand these sandwiches don't often come with happy people. My people tell me that the norm is a cash only, cranky grimy stand up joint is the norm. This place? Go see for yourself. Oh. Eat. Way more fun than seeing. Other addictive (so I'm told) foods like deep dish pizza, etc are on menu too.

5Cgc_BuJ9v_2fTYOrBISUw.text: Love this place, and I've turned my coworkers on to it! I have yet to have anything I didn't like. The pizzas puffs are absolute amazing!! They are always friendly, food is always made to order, and they always have a special. They normally always have a deal on Groupon as well.

NA9_YCa9Locww5pUcsHAKA.text: Not sure what some of the bad reviews are about but Ive lived in Vegas a little over a year and the customer service here has always been great. Food is always good and we will always be coming back. Being born and raised in Chicago my whole life the food here reminds me of the traditional "hotdog stand" back home.

GBj4no8a9ixKsn0TYEPcvA.text: I'm a huge fan of this restaurant.  As a life-long Chicagoan and fairly recent transplant to Las Vegas, I can't endorse their food enough.  The service is great and everything tastes like it did back in Chicago.  Real Vienna beef and hot dogs, S. Rosen poppyseed buns, pizza puffs, Jay's potato chips, Old Style beer and Green River soda can all be found here!    I've had the pizza and the thin crust is crisp with just the right amount of sauce and cheese.  The deep dish has a sweet tomato sauce on top and the pepperoni actually has a little bit of spice to it, which is way better than the bland stuff the chains use.  The crust is a butter crust similar to Lou Malnati's or Ricobene's deep dish.  The hot dogs are made authentic Chicago-style (no ketchup) and include the neon green relish, mustard, celery salt and sport peppers on a Vienna beef dog with a poppyseed bun.  Can't get any better than that.  The Italian beef is by far my favorite.  On an Italian roll, of course you have to get it dipped so the bread is falling apart and the au jus runs down your arm.  If you like spicy stuff, get their homemade hot giardinera made with habanero peppers.  No need to thank me.  I highly recommend this place, especially if you already "know" Chicago food.

cZucGBqB3Ia2sluQOrGaSg.text: Best Chicago style pizza in Las Vegas! It's been a while since we have had something that "claims" to be Chicago style actually lives up to the name.

UpJwqpohYQpqAJ-qJ7GwVg.text: Great pies and sausages from this place, this place will take a while to make the pizza but very good and saucy!

89WC_Lw0CN35spgKK0r6TQ.text: Best wings in town, laid back atmosphere family friendly and quick service. Pizza is pretty delicious too!!

bHp-c2AnPyUqvD-nLMfmsA.text: Great Chicago style pizza. Their sauce is super tasty.

VZ_g5PGrtuDtsaMsWvldMg.text: I'm a pizza nut & I've been in Henderson for 5 years & ordered from every spot in the valley. Hands down, WC is the best pizza you can get delivered. Asked for the pizza well done & was delivered perfectly. If you order Angelina's or one of the other clown companies that have 500 items on the menu, you're an idiot & you'll regret it.

PazMvlsJteFqY4vGOaVovg.text: Best Chicago food in Las Vegas!!  You must have the pizza, whether you like traditional deep dish or thin they have you covered.  They have Italian Beefs and homemade  Giardiniera and homemade cannoli. Great for any Chicago sports fan to watch a game!

dLAb13uc0XGyIeOkKXtpgg.text: As a first time customer, I wish my experience with WCBP was better.  I called in to place a take out order and having never dined here before my Husband and I had a few questions on the menu.  While on the phone I paused for a moment to hear the question my Husband asked and the woman taking my order snapped at me saying "hey I've got a line of people here, so do you want to just call back or what?"  I literally paused my sentence for a whole 5 seconds.  When I picked up my food I got no thanks for coming in, nothing, and the food I ordered was average at best.  Oh and they forgot one of my sides of french fries.  Husband says Chicagoans are just curt by nature but we aren't in Chicago and a new customer shouldn't be treated with so much disrespect.

vLO5epy2u8OG6gmWsRi7Vg.text: First of all, I know everyone from Chi-town and NYC won't ever admit that the food is as authentic as from their home city. Okay, well get over that! This place is legit coming from a guy who loves Portillos, Super Dawg, and Hot Dougs. Their Chicago dog tastes the same has Portillos. I used to do business in Chicago, so I went their a lot and had the usual Chicago staple. The irony is that my friends from Chicago don't eat Chicago dogs, Deepdish pizza, and Italian Beefs on a daily basis which I probably ate more Chicago food than them. I recommend this place for the Chicago dogs because I haven't tried the Italian beef like Al's in Chicago.

q8Qlgkz4byIYVCTo_ReSFw.text: I have several times walked by this establishment while visiting others nearby and always wondered about the food.  This time I thought I would give it a try.  I walked in and was greeted with a "hello" by the counter person.  I noticed one other customer I believe sitting at a table.  Looked clean and tidy nothing special, so I proceeded to order chicken wings mild which came with fries. My order was to go. The wings were soggy and flavorless and the mild sauce was given to me on the side in a little container.  The fries were in a bag and were greasy and soggy as well.  I really couldn't eat but two wings and I had to throw it away, it just was grossing me out.  I'm sorry but they need to step up to the plate literally and get their game on.  Your not the only wing, dog, pizza joint in town.

FmnR2lmsvRbFsOufIViepQ.text: I'm from Chicago and miss Chicago food but I love this place.  During lunch they have slices available but only until they run out of what they're made so the earlier the better.  I've had their beef sandwich wet with cheese and sweet peppers and it was superb.  I've had their Wednesday special:  beef and sausage combo and the flavor was just like home.  Had a slice of deep dish cheese pizza and it was great.  Tina is the hostess and order taker and is friendly.  Also recommend their cannoli's!  Fresh and crispy shell with delicious filling.  Did I say  I love this place??  Am just getting over my cancer battle and can't wait to get back there.

PKdTdT4A98TYu1ZjoNC1HA.text: Well thin crust is terrible.  But Chicago style is spot on. Will go there for the beefs and Chicago style for sure. The service isn't the friendliest.  But makes me feel like im back in chi lol

i5y7atxAgdGHVXRpAZpxaA.text: I have been searching for Chicago style deep dish QUALITY pizza since I moved to Vegas and this is the ONLY restaurant who lived up to expectations.  There are other restaurants in the City that claim to serve Chicago style pizza, but the crust is not right nor is the sauce, etc.  Windy City does it RIGHT!  I just wish they had a location near Summerlin!!  VERY GOOD and I recommend them highly for pizza!

ON2vhgO78yETq6SpWNzNZA.text: This was my first time trying out some Chicago eats, and let me tell you, it did not dissapoint. We decided to order the Chicago style deep dish pizza, I had never had deep dish pizza before, but I didn't see what the big deal was - it's a pizza with a but more dough. This was my pre- first bite opinion, and I was so very, very wrong. The pizza came, all hot and with the sauce on top- I was weirded out for sure, but then I took a bite and it changed my life forever. Not even kidding, I was still eating the thing even when I was full. Not only was this pizza the best deep dish Chicago style pizza I have ever had, but it is THE best pizza I have ever  had. It was a great foodie moment, but then the realization hit me - I live thousands and thousands of miles away from here and in a different county to boot! All I have to say is if you are in Vegas, try this pizza, it will forever change your life. If I am ever back in Vegas, this is the first and last place I want to stop in to grab me a slice of pizza pie heaven! The place sort of looks like your unsuspecting average pizza joint, but don't be fooled, amazing pizza lives here!

WsTj-n9F8fwJO9jJ_Upomg.text: Came in while visiting Vegas off of a Groupon deal...have to say it was the best pizza and cannoli my husband and I have had in ages! I know I will be wishing this place was closer to home! Great food, great people, great place to watch football game, just a great place that we look forward to coming back to...thank you Windy City Pizza!!!

K51P3TQjEse51ekhUcTMaw.text: We went today with the Groupon deal. I expected it to be a quiet, slow place but it seemed to have a steady stream of people. We ordered and when I asked about how long the deep dish takes, they said 30 minutes. Luckily we had our salads to keep us occupied. Salad was good. The lettuce was fresh and green. It was topped with purple onion and two tomato slices. Could have used some shredded cheese just to make it look more appealing. Husband for the ranch and I got the creamy garlic dressing. They were both good. The garlic dressing was more of the consistency of mayo but it had a good taste. The pizza came out faster than 30 minutes. It was the perfect the perfect temp. Not so hot that we had to wait. It was huge! There was so much cheese! The cheese oozed off the peices. It was was delicious! The crust was crispy on the edges yet still soft under the cheese. It really was delicious! We didn't try the cannolis that were including in the deal because we were so full. We took them to go. We will for sure be back for the pizza. It was really good and would feed a lot of people since one piece is so big! The service was good. The lady was nice. It seemed they were having a problem in the kitchen and the guy in the back seemed irritated with the cashier but that had nothing to do with our transaction. One thing I did notice was there were several customers that came in and called (what I'm thinking is the owner) by name and he knew all their names and joked with them. He and the cashier really seemed to know their customers which I think is great. We had a nice experience and will be back to try more of their food!

xiOlZv2lYZF5jxoQzwO62Q.text: Closest thing to Chicago pizza I have found here in Vegas. I have only tried a few pizza places but this is the best by far. Now I have try the beef and see if it measures up also. Great job so far keep up the good work.

owcANJpuYdbuStEIZkOkjA.text: Great pizza I even like it better than Gino's in Chicago. We had a chance to talk to the owner really nice guy and very down to earth. The sauce was great and the groupon was a plus we being from out of town would never had ventured of the strip if it wasn't for the groupons. One slice was enough to fill you up even with a salad prior. The cannoli's were great as well nice flavor to them. Not alot of places have cannoli's and if they do they are yuck. The only reason is wasn't 5 stars is the girl at the counter was rude and had the personality of a flea. Hope she has a great vacation since we had to hear about it. If we ever get back that way we will def stop again.

3hkzwismKVaixQh461VP-A.text: Not sure what the hype is about this place. Ordered the beef sandwich and found it to have little to no flavor. Sandwich was a pretty decent size, though. They also serve the Supreme tamales here which I miss dearly.

SB52OXUvupgGc-iFq_RHGg.text: Glad we ordered from this place last night! We ordered a pepperoni deep dish pizza and mild wings. Delicious deep dish pizza! We were visiting in the area and decided to try this place because of the reviews. Wasn't disappointed at all! Great food and we had it delivered- food was still very warm!

rVggTBIDm_IPJtiaYzVvEA.text: So disappointed in this 'taste of Chicago'!  Being from Chicago, whenever I see a restaurant that advertises its product as authentic Chicago food, I have to try it.  Tonight I stopped by to order the Italian beef/sausage combos for takeout from Windy City Beefs 'n Pizza.  The young lady behind the counter kept insisting how Chicago authentic the food was, but when asked if she was from Chicago, she stated no.  However, on with my order, the "Chicago" beef.  First of all, the sandwich didn't consist of "thin slices" of beef as described in their menu but instead the beef in the sandwich was in very small pieces.  And something that is repetitive all over the Valley when it comes to so-called "Chicago" beef sandwiches -- if you order a beef sandwich with sausage (called a combo), the amount of beef in the sandwich is minimal, nothing like Chicago!  In Chicago when you order a combo, besides the sausage, they smother the sandwich with beef piled high.  The bread had no consistency; it was soggy and falling apart.  And, it was shocking to see what Windy City calls giardiniera.  It's nowhere near authentic Chicago giardiniera.  Chicago giardiniera does not have jalapenos and the oregano in it was way too much.  It was spicy and tasteless.  Unbelievable!  As for their pizzas, looking at what the customers were eating reminded me of Tombstone pizzas.  Just saying.    There is nothing of Chicago here.  Too many disappointments!  Won't return, for sure!

9TJBi3Y5hCzlprqhm9tuAw.text: My roommate called Windy City tonight to place a delivery order from his cell & Tina answered, she was extremely rude and nasty saying "We don't deliver to you, your out of our 5 miles zone" Which is a complete crock because on April 8th at 8:19pm I placed an order for delivery with Nena V check number 126, Approval code for my debit card is 041923. Yes I have the receipt which everyone can on Windy City's Facebook Page. My roommate then called back and asked to speak with the manager because her attitude was so bad and the fact she lied to him about the delivery, he wanted to let someone know. Well when he called back and asked for the manager she proceeds to say "Oh Jeff, well the manager is cooking he will call you back" He is from Chicago, He Loves the food here and even got me admit Chicago does better pizza and I'm from New York. but after this experience we both will NEVER go there again. We rather drive to the other side of town and go their location on Lake Mead. Also watch out for out for this locations apparent bad business practices because I just noticed on my bank statement they charged me $38.13. I did NOT give a $10 dollar tip!!!!!!   If you notice on the receipt I was already charged $3.00 for a tip!!!!

EPP57JY4Fn7LiiABT_MjWA.text: Wow just amazing,i've been craving a Chicago deep dish for so long and I wasn't disappointed had a beef while I waited for my pie best I've had in years. And the service was outstanding super nice and helpful

QIP9IZ2I4lBAQjmKLbuZJA.text: Yet another Chicago transplant who stumbled upon this place... Walking inside I couldn't keep the grin off my face as it really resembled a Chicago hole in the wall. In a good way! (Place was actually very clean and organized. Perhaps they should spill some beer on the floor to get that authentic Windy City sticky feel) ordered the Chicago dogs to be safe and they hit the nail on the head! Next up chili dog, but I may have to draw the line with the deep dish... MAYBE...

ZCG-i6mo9pHqYIF5BLf8Kw.text: I'm from Chitown, I'm incredibly picky especially when it comes to the food--  I mean I will give you the stink eye if you dare put ketchup on my hotdog. Maxwells used to be 20 min from my house and I've never known hotdogs to be made any other way.  My husband and I were homesick and hoping to find something that would remind us of home--This in my book is the closest I've seen in Chicago type foods since I've moved here. The beefs are awesome and staff was cordial. We'll be back when we get homesick again.

Hqspmiedrs1dMjIPThAD8Q.text: In town for a few days& the kids wanted pizza! They said the best they've ever had, I agree! Great service and food!

LlX9TgwmoRPDMr99LUgE_w.text: A must visit hole is the wall. Their pizza is amazing, probably the best pizza I've ever had.
